KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Alternating patches of sand and cracked earth seem to endlessly pass beneath Eidos' feet. The same barren sights persist step after infinite step. Mouth agape, wanting to drool but incapable of producing even a single drop of spittle, Eidos stares at the floor as her feet drag, kicking up meager clouds of dust and sand. But unrelenting winds sweep those clouds away and erase any footprints she may have left behind, leaving no evidence of her passage, no reminder of her existence.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: A break in the howling winds, grants her eyes the freedom to look up and forward. The Wasteland spire grows nearer. From this vantage point, she now sees that it is but a small part of a broad, stout fortification, several hundred paces wide. This structure is built into the lip of a massive crater, stopping it up, and preventing the flow of anything in or out. On either side, a stairway leads to the top of the fortress walls, where a number of amorphous dots pace to and fro.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.0002!DESCR.dialogue_text: As she draws nearer, it becomes clear that this site is occupied by an armed company of warriors, no fewer than a hundred or so. Some sit leisurely about polishing armor and weapons, while others doze in the shade of the beacon towering above. Yet all are united in their ambivalence toward her approach.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.0003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Finally reaching their encampment, Eidos collapses at a nearby water cistern. No one cares to impede her as she drinks her fill, though one of the soldiers takes notice of Eidos and shoots his time-worn gaze her way. He makes no move to approach or to speak, content with simply glowering.

A.response_text: Climb to the top of the walls

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos climbs the stairs and mounts the battlements atop the wall; her climb rewarded with a curious sight...

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: From the parapet upon which she stands, a massive stone ramp descends into the crater below. Kicking a pebble down towards the ramp, Eidos observes that it takes a second to reach the sloped surface, leading her to surmise that it is quite possible to survive the descent. However, noting the mirror-polished, slick surfaces of the wall, she likewise sees that it is equally impossible to climb back up.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.102!DESCRI.dialogue_text: It would seem that the whole complex is designed to invite invaders from the crater to mount the ramp only to be rebuffed by its formidable walls. The presence of a number of watchful archers here leaves no doubt about the fate of those attempting to scale the fort's perimeter.

A.response_text: Jump down upon the ramp and descend into the crater

B.response_text: Go back down the stairs to leave Ark's Beacon.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X200!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos walks over to the aged Tacribian to strike up a conversation. He watches her every move with the apathy of a lion staring down a hyena.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.201!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The conversation at its end, Eidos considers what to do next.

A.response_text: Climb to the top of the walls

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X300!DESCR.dialogue_text: The archer greets Eidos' approach with the same warmth and affection as the Wasteland has - though at least she does not ignore Eidos' salutation...

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.301!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The conversation at its terminus, Eidos ponders her subsequent course of action.

A.response_text: Jump down upon the ramp and descend into the crater

B.response_text: Go back down the stairs to leave Ark's Beacon.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Alternating patches of sand and cracked earth seem to endlessly pass beneath Eidos' feet. The same barren sights persist step after infinite step. Mouth agape, wanting to drool but incapable of producing even a single drop of spittle, Eidos stares at the floor as her feet drag, kicking up meager clouds of dust and sand. But unrelenting winds sweep those clouds away and erase any footprints she may have left behind, leaving no evidence of her passage, no reminder of her existence.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A break in the howling winds grants her eyes the freedom to look up and forward. The Wasteland spire grows nearer. From this vantage point, she now sees that it is but a small part of a broad, stout fortification, several hundred paces wide. This structure is built into the lip of a massive crater, stopping it up, and preventing the flow of anything in or out.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
When near enough, she sees evidence of recent habitation - abandoned tents, bedrolls, and ashy campfire remains, to name a few. Even a small water cistern sits nearby, though it is now as empty as the facilities it services. At present, it seems the sole occupants of Ark’s Beacon are solitude and fading memories.

		Bringing her attention to the wall whose shadow now envelops her, she notices that on either side, a stairway leads to the top of the fortress walls.

		Suddenly, laughter shatters the solemn silence of the Wastes, reminding Eidos she is not actually alone. She turns to find Heyar some twenty paces off, laughing at one of his own inane jokes - probably the same one.

A.response_text: Climb the stairs to the top of the wall

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos climbs the stairs and mounts the battlements atop the wall where her ascent is rewarded with a curious sight...

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: From the parapet upon which she stands, a massive stone ramp descends into the crater below. She kicks a pebble down onto the ramp. A second later, it cracks against the sloped surface of the crater. The descent seems a simple task. However, given the smooth surfaces of the wall, a return ascent seems inversely proportional in its simplicity. In truth, the whole complex appears to be designed to invite invaders from the crater to mount the ramp only to then rebuff them with its formidable walls.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.102!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, out of the corner of her eye, Eidos senses some movement. Turning sharply, she sees that it's just Heyar making odd gestures in the air and mumbling to himself.

A.response_text: Jump down upon the ramp and descend into the crater

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X500!DESCR.dialogue_text: The eccentric scholar is sitting down in the sand, drawing bizarre symbols, as Eidos shuffles her feet his way. When she is finally upon him, Heyar stares up at her with a grin that would make any sane person want to slap it straight from his face into oblivion.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.501!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Their conversation, mercifully finished. Eidos is left with deciding which course of action to pursue.

A.response_text: Jump down upon the ramp and descend into the crater

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.901!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos makes for the wall to leave. Heyar is lost in thought lecturing himself while making grand gesticulations.\n\n\t\tThis is the end of their journey together. A tragic separation or a joyful release - or a false dichotomy?

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Alternating patches of sand and cracked earth seem to endlessly pass beneath Eidos' feet. The same barren sights persist step after infinite step. Mouth agape, wanting to drool but incapable of producing even a single drop of spittle, Eidos stares at the floor as her feet drag, kicking up meager clouds of dust and sand. But unrelenting winds sweep those clouds away and erase any footprints she may have left behind, leaving no evidence of her passage, no reminder of her existence.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A break in the howling winds, grants her eyes the freedom to look up and forward. The Wasteland spire grows nearer. From this vantage point, she now sees that it is but a small part of a broad, stout fortification, several hundred paces wide. This structure is built into the lip of a massive crater, stopping it up, and preventing the flow of anything in or out.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: When near enough, she sees evidence of recent habitation - abandoned tents, bedrolls and ashy campfire remains, to name a few. Yet, nothing living remains in this lonely place. Bringing her attention to the wall whose shadow now envelops her, she notices that on either side, a stairway leads to the top of the fortress walls.

A.response_text: Climb to the top of the walls

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos climbs the stairs and mounts the battlements atop the wall; her climb rewarded with a curious sight...

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: From the parapet upon which she stands, a massive stone ramp descends into the crater below. Kicking a pebble down towards the ramp, Eidos observes that it takes a second to reach the sloped surface, leading her to surmise that it is quite possible to survive the descent. However, noting the mirror-polished, slick surfaces of the wall, she likewise sees that it is equally impossible to climb back up. It would seem that the whole complex is designed to invite invaders from the crater to mount the ramp only to be rebuffed by its formidable walls.

A.response_text: Jump down upon the ramp and descend into the crater

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.901!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
Surveying the oppressive spire and the desolate fort, she conjures up visions of proud warriors milling about performing their duties with due diligence.

		Though this flame in the dark of the Wasteland has been extinguished, she perceives a fleeting awareness: the certainty that the soldiers would be here again, in the future, in the past and now. She feels as though there are archers standing upon the parapet with her, staring down into the crater she now wishes to enter.

		This paradoxical insight dances on the periphery of her Awareness, but then evaporates like water turned to steam in the desert heat. Gone, but still there. Now there is nothing left but to descend into the crater below. And obediently, Eidos descends.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: All around, the dark walls of the crater rebuff those who would exit. With their exponential curves and loose charcoal stones the prevent would-be climbers from reaching the crest. In truth, it would almost be easier to dig a way out than to tempt fate and begin a suicidal climb to the top. But as bonkers as it may seem, there appears to be evidence of just such an attempt to tear down a portion of the crater's walls. A concerted effort in a western wall has brought down a sizable portion of it and at one time surely promised a path to freedom. However, the passage is now thwarted by a massive man-made wall with an imposing spire jutting upwards from the middle, like a closed fist with a single digit pointing skyward.\n\n\t\tEidos heads toward it.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Coming to an incline significantly more forgiving than the walls, she begins a tenuous climb up the uneven surface towards the lip of the crater and the fortress above. Loosened stones slip beneath her feet, stealing her balance momentarily, and sharp stones nick her hands as she clutches them when regaining her footing. The spire simply peers out over the canyon dispassionately, ambivalent towards her efforts to reach it.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: But reach it she does. Once at the fortification, she looks for a method to move beyond it. Eidos sees no doors, no ladders, no possibility of passing the obstruction. Archers at the top of the battlements stare down at her from above, silent but vigilant. They remain motionless, desiring neither to hinder nor to help her. They simply observe, arrows nocked and fingers on their bowstrings.

A.response_text: Return to the Stilled Sand Crater

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.010!DESCR.dialogue_text: All around, the dark walls of the crater rebuff those who would exit. With their exponential curves and loose charcoal stones the prevent would-be climbers from reaching the crest. In truth, it would almost be easier to dig a way out than to tempt fate and begin a suicidal climb to the top. But as bonkers as it may seem, there appears to be evidence of just such an attempt to tear down a portion of the crater's walls. A concerted effort in a western wall has brought down a sizable portion of it and at one time surely promised a path to freedom. However, the passage is now thwarted by a massive man-made wall with an imposing spire jutting upwards from the middle, like a closed fist with a single digit pointing skyward.\n\n\t\tEidos heads toward it.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.011!DESCR.dialogue_text: Coming to an incline significantly more forgiving than the walls, she begins a tenuous climb up the uneven surface towards the lip of the crater and the fortress above. Loosened stones slip beneath her feet, stealing her balance momentarily, and sharp stones nick her hands as she clutches them when regaining her footing. The spire simply peers out over the canyon dispassionately, ambivalent towards her efforts to reach it.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.012!DESCR.dialogue_text: But reach it she does. Once at the fortification, she looks for a method to move beyond it. Eidos sees no doors, no ladders, no possibility of passing the obstruction. Further, not a single person appears to be guarding the place, as though it alone were enough to ward off any ne'er-do-wells. Case in point, it seems it is sufficient to thwart Eidos at the very least and she is forced to return to the crater whence she came.

A.response_text: Return to the Stilled Sand Crater

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!90.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: Though he appeared to have entered death's embrace, there is a resurgence of life in the stubborn scholar as he gasps for air, futilely clinging to life. Heyar dramatically clutches his wounds as he disappointedly gazes upon the crimson flow gushing from wound to sand. His dying body twitches and shudders in an effort to make one last, grand gesticulation as his doom draws near...

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!90.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: After an intolerably lengthy period of concerted effort and hyperbolic moans of agony, he manages to raise a finger, as though trying to pause a conversation, to interject a final word before he is forever silenced. Here Heyar makes his last stand against Nature and the Harbinger of his cruel fate!

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!90.X002!DESC.dialogue_text: Yet, his dying thoughts go mercifully unspoken as his ghost passes on into the great unknown.

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "You're an odd one, aren't you? No one 'cept a Tacribian would pass through the Dawn Gate willingly..."

A.response_text: "Some are made to come against their will?"

D.response_text: "So Tacribians are the only ones foolish enough to do so?"

E.response_text: "My presence here proves otherwise."

F.response_text: "I can see why! You guys are boring!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.100!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "Most of the 'visitors' we get aren't welcome in Kabu anymore, if you catch my drift..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "They all just end up here and we just kick 'em over the wall into the crater. Wraithglow gets 'em and they go draug. Always the same story."

A.response_text: "Criminal justice in Kabu is strict, it seems."

E.response_text: "So if I sliced up a few draugnir, no one would complain?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.200!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "That's because most of the 'visitors' we get aren't welcome in Kabu anymore, if you catch my drift..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.2000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "They all just end up here and we just kick 'em over the wall into the crater. Wraithglow gets 'em and they go draug. Always the same story."

A.response_text: "Criminal justice in Kabu is strict, it seems."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.3000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "So then you must also know that our 'visitors' just get kicked over the wall into the crater before they go draug, right princess?"

D.response_text: "I don't recall asking for the explanation."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X400!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Yeah, and now you find yourself among the ranks of the draug-brains to come out here of their own accord, princess."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.4000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "I hope for your sake that your bite is as fierce as your bark..."

D.response_text: "And I hope for your sake that you never have to find out..."

E.response_text: "A shame the dead can't speak, or you could ask my enemies."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.4001!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Yeah, and now you find yourself among the ranks of the draug-brains to come out here of their own accord, princess."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.4002!ADARI.dialogue_text: "I hope for your sake that your blade is as sharp as your tongue..."

D.response_text: "And I hope for your sake that you never have to find out..."

E.response_text: "Don't tempt Luin, Tacribian; you'll end up tongueless if you do."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.500!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "I'd guess the only thing you're proving here is that you're tired of living..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.5000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "See, if our 'guests' prove to be too much of a nuisance we 'invite' them over the wall and into the crater to get a tan from the wraithglow... You catch my drift, sweetie?"

A.response_text: "Criminal justice in Kabu is strict, it seems."

D.response_text: "I don't recall asking for the explanation."

E.response_text: "You'll see the wall from the crater-side if you threaten me again, sweetie."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.6000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Well, since you're bored, why don't you go play with the draugnir in the crater, little girl?"

F.response_text: "Not just boring, but stupid, too, it seems..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.101!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "It's gotta be. Order is the basis of a stable society, sweet cheeks."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.201!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "Technically, they bring it upon themselves, sweet cheeks."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.301!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "You've certainly got a way with words, dontcha honey buns?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.3010!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Well, would you look at the time..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.401!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "Right... try spending more time out in the Wasteland, kid."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.4010!ADARI.dialogue_text: "And if you actually make it back here in one piece, then we'll let you sit at the grownups table."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X4011!ADAR.dialogue_text: "Now run along and play Magi and Jinns out in the Wastes!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.5011!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Hey! Guys! Did you here that? Luin! By the Dark Jinn's black arse, that's rich!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X5012!ADAR.dialogue_text: "All right, kid, scurry along now to go play Ark vs. Rikharr out in the crater with the draugnir. Ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X601!ADARI.dialogue_text: "What are you still doing here?! Jinns take you!"

F.response_text: "I'd love to, bro, but I'm afraid I have to leave."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.901!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "But let's not waste anymore time, shall we?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.902!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "I'll tell you about the terrain if you want, otherwise make like Biracul and disappear into the Wastes."

A.response_text: "Thanks, anything of note in the area?"

E.response_text: "Criminals and draugnir would make better company than you lot."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1020!ADARI.dialogue_text: "These are the Wastes, lady; there's nothing 'of note'."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1021!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Look, if you have any chances of getting through here, it'll be through the Salt Forest. But unless you're Biracul himself, you won't be making it out unscathed."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1022!ADARI.dialogue_text: "No, the wraithglow'll get you... Gets everyone, good men and jinnspawn alike..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1023!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Might just be better to get ripped up by draugnir."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X1024!ADAR.dialogue_text: "But enough about that, go on and get out of here. My shift on the walls is coming up!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.202!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "The Salt Forest is up north. It's basically draug-free, but the wraithglow is the reward for making it through - would be better to get ripped to shreds by a draug than to join 'em, if you ask me..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.2020!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Beyond the Obsidian Ruin out to the southwest is a canyon with a mad woman, a Valvorthr, recently exiled."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.2021!ADARI.dialogue_text: "You might be wondering why a Tacribian was exiled. Well, my guess is that it's probably because she never shuts up! Speaks as much as a jinnkissed Daziran, that one..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.2022!ADARI.dialogue_text: "The Stilled Sand Crater beyond this here wall is crawling with undying draugnir. You're welcome to go into the crater, but you won't be coming back this side ever again, mind you."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X2023!ADAR.dialogue_text: "But enough about that, go on and get out of here. I gotta get back to work!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X000!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Move along now, sweetie. Some of us have real work to do."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X001!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Still around, kid? Make like Biracul and vanish into the Wastes! Or at least go do something worth talking about!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X002!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Jinns take you, woman! Scram before I throw you over the wall myself!"

F.response_text: "You don't look strong enough to lift a person."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.000!ADARIK.dialogue_text: "Just ignore her, Adarik. She'll get bored and go away."

F.response_text: "Yooooooohoo! I'm still here!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.001!ADARI.dialogue_text: "Huh, not much different looking than a normal human, I'd say..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!10.X002!ADAR.dialogue_text: "Well, lost interest. Now leave before the archers use you for target practice!"

D.response_text: "Who do you expect to see coming up this ramp?"

E.response_text: "I see you're all very brave, hiding behind this wall."

F.response_text: "Are you an elf?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.100!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "Your slayer before the week is out, likely as not."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1000!BISHR.dialogue_text: "I'll try to make it mercifully quick. A shot through the eye should end it painlessly."

B.response_text: "If you say so. What's up with this crater, anyway?"

E.response_text: "Then I'll make your death needlessly painful."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.200!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "Whatever you're trying to do, I'll still kill you when the wraithglow takes you."

A.response_text: "Why would you need to do that?"

B.response_text: "If you say so. But honestly I'm more interest in this crater."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.400!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "Before the week's out, you, likely as not."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.4000!BISHR.dialogue_text: "But I'll put a shot through your eye when the wraithglow gets you. Your suffering will be brief; you've my word of honor as one of Ark's Valvorthr."

D.response_text: "Are we enemies then?"

E.response_text: "Then you have my word your death will be needlessly painful."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.500!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "I don't need to be brave to slay the enemies of Ark; all I need to do is my duty."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.5001!BISHR.dialogue_text: "But when the wraithglow gets you, I'll make your death mercifully quick."

D.response_text: "Are we enemies then?"

E.response_text: "Is that so? Then I'll make your death needlessly painful."

F.response_text: "Aren't archers often elves? Or at least, metrosexuals. Where's your man purse?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.101!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "You'll be a draugnir before long; the wraithglow doesn't discriminate."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X1010!BISH.dialogue_text: "If you get an opportunity, you should end your life before that happens. The Salt Forest might be your swiftest option."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X201!BISHR.dialogue_text: "The crater? Don't know how it got here and don't much care."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X301!BISHR.dialogue_text: "Hope? Hard to live on that out here..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X401!BISHR.dialogue_text: "It doesn't matter what we are. If you return here walking without Trueflesh, my arrow'll find you."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X501!BISHR.dialogue_text: "Sorry, promises from the dead aren't worth much."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.601!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "Must have left it back at the barracks... maybe. Not sure if I even have one."

F.response_text: "Hey, can I borrow your bow and shoot some stuff!?"

A.response_text: "Ugh! Fine! But if I get a cool weapon, I'm not sharing it with you!"

F.response_text: "Come on! Just one draug and then I'll never ask again!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.000!BISHRA.dialogue_text: "Speaking to you won't help me in my mission to defend the beacon - might just make it more difficult. Leave me, outlander."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.X000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm...  Oh, it's you! And alive at that! We appear to have both beaten the odds thus far..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Did you come to Ark's Beacon to survey the Stilled Sand Crater, as I have?"

A.response_text: "Why have you come to survey the crater?"

C.response_text: "This is where the wind brought me."

D.response_text: "Why's there a fortified wall here..?"

E.response_text: "Didn't I tell you to leave me alone?"

F.response_text: "I hereby decree this to be Stalpholopolis! In honor of... ME!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.100!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Why to look upon the dreaded draugnir, of course!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "This is the outpost responsible for keeping the draugnir at bay: Ark's Beacon! So named in memory of the great mage Ark."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Such irony that Tacribians adore her to the point of deification, yet most don't realize she was originally from Dazir! That's why history is so important, so that..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.1002!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Oh dear, I'm sorry; am I speaking too much again?"

A.response_text: "Not at all! But why should it matter she was from Dazir?"

D.response_text: "What threat do these draugnir pose?"

E.response_text: "It's more ironic that you speak so much when none want to listen."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.300!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "You're fortunate indeed to have been blown to such a fascinating place!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.400!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Why? Because otherwise the draugnir would crawl up towards the Dawn Fortress! That's why!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.4000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "This outpost keeps the draugnir at bay and is designed to alert Kabu of a new Jinnwraith appearance!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.500!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Did you? Ha ha! Sorry! I just love talking to people!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.5000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Don't mind me! I'll just go on with my investigations on my own then!"

D.response_text: "Do so, unless you ever have anything useful to say."

E.response_text: "Do so in silence, unless you want investigate life after death."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.600!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! Well, now that you've poisoned all the Tacribians, I suppose that does make you their conqueror, in a way!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!0.6000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "But this isn't much of a city, so perhaps I could recommend Fort Stalphos instead? Ha ha! Sorry!"

F.response_text: "Seek not my forgiveness for your misdeeds, but that of Roostor."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Yes! Elementary! This is the outpost responsible for keeping the draugnir at bay: Ark's Beacon! So named in memory of the great mage Ark."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.0000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Such irony that Tacribians adore her to the point of deification, yet most don't realize she was originally from Dazir! That's why history is so important, so that..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.0001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Oh dear, I'm sorry; am I speaking too much again?"

A.response_text: "Not at all! But why should it matter Ark was from Dazir?"

D.response_text: "What threat do these draugnir pose?"

E.response_text: "It's more ironic you speak so much when none want to listen."

F.response_text: "Those blasphemers don't realize that Roostor is the apex deity!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.100!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! No, but it does! Because Tacribians and Dazirans hate each other, despite their shared heritage - and sibling rivalries are rarely ideological, ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.1000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "The last time they were united was when Ark defended Kabu from the Jinnwraith Rikharr, some four hundred years ago!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.1001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "And in a gorgeous twist of fate, Rikharr was a Tacribian-born Daziran mage! Ha ha!"

A.response_text: "Could this knowledge help promote peace among them?"

E.response_text: "Perhaps we need another Jinnwraith..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.200!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "More!? Why of course! Ha ha! Where was I? Ah, yes: Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.2000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "You see, Ark was a mage unparalleled in Kaban history - had a list of unprecedented successes longer than most tomes, at that! Notable among them was a mastery of the Wellspring rivaling even the Heathen and her taming of the Emerald's ghelblade Luin..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.2001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Oh! And of course, she also defeated the Jinnwraith Rikharr, whose evil reign she overthrew when she joined all three contingents some four hundred years ago!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.2002!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "One might argue that she wrote our history! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.300!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Oh! Sorry! I just believe that discussion is part of a balanced life - though the more, the better I say!"

D.response_text: "Well, the less the better, I say."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.400!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm? Ah, the draugnir! Yes, the draugnir will attack unprovoked, but lack the ability to assemble into a unified force without a Jinnwraith as a catalyst."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.4000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "And Jinnwraiths, well, they're draugnir who by some ill got deal with the Jinns maintain their sentience even after being consumed by the wraithglow! But Jinnwraiths are few and far between - only been one in recorded history! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.4001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "So absent the sudden appearance of a Jinnwraith and as long as this wall and the Gate of Celestial Judgment in Tambul stand firm, Kabu will likely remain safe! Ha ha!"

D.response_text: "Better to let sleeping draugnir lie, it seems..."

E.response_text: "Perhaps we need another Jinnwraith..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.500!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "You're free with your words, but I shall keep my musings to a minimum. Ha ha! Sorry!"

D.response_text: "Do so, unless what you have to say is useful."

E.response_text: "Do so in silence, unless you want investigate life after death."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.600!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... the Loremaster Dary of Dazir might know about Roostor, but I deal more with history than myth! Ha ha! Sorry!"

F.response_text: "Myth?! In Roostor's name, DIE blasphemer!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.101!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! Ark was indeed the glue that held Kabu together at one point."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.1010!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "But the fatal flaw in a cult of personality is that the cult dies with them!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.1011!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "History reminds us that peace only comes after a great historical figure unifies people, and war follows when those left behind begin vying for personal gain and power."

A.response_text: "Then perhaps a new Ark is needed."

E.response_text: "Peace is a conceit of the insulated society."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.1014!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Leave the recording of this new history to me, Heyar the Historian! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X1015!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Sorry, but this is too exciting! Let's continue with our exploration, shall we!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.201!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Ark, you say? Well, as legend has it, she fell along with the Sun Keep and the Jinnwraith Rikharr through the Crescent Canyon and into the Graylands."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.2010!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "After the chaos from the draug assault died down, people descended into the canyon to find her remains, so that she could be venerated - as all Daziran magi are, naturally - with her bones being placed in the Chamber of Bones in the Wellspring."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.2011!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Though, it's rumored that her remains were never found... Ha ha! Hmm...  What could this means?"

B.response_text: "Are you implying Ark survived the fall?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.2012!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Ha ha! Well, Biracul works in mysterious ways! If Ark survived the fall and walked with Biracul, what a fantastic end for such a remarkable historical personage that would be!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X2013!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Sorry! Ha ha! I'm giddier than a Jinn with a sinner! Let's continue with our exploration, shall we!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X301!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Not interested in discussion, eh? Sorry! I'll keep my musings to a minimum! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X401!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Indeed! Ha ha! Shall we continue on our quest for knowledge then?!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.501!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Another Jinnwraith, you say? Yes! That might indeed unify the townships once more..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.5010!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "But I'm afraid with the current state of affairs, what with the fragmentation of duties and the lack of unified leadership, that the effects of another Jinnwraith attack would be absolutely catastrophic rather than inspirational! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.5011!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Though it would certainly leave another ripple in the fabric of Kaban history..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.5012!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "And I'd get to act as witness and chronicler!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!1.X5013!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Sorry! Enough with hypotheticals! Let's continue on our quest for knowledge!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burned brightly in the bosom of... Hmm...  What was your name again? Sorry!"

D.response_text: "Empress Eidos, to you."

E.response_text: "Eidos, the Destroyer."

F.response_text: "Stalphos Gremlinsbane, champion of Roostor!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ah! Eidos! Yes, of course! Where was I then... Hmm..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.0010!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burning brightly in the bosom of Eidos!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.X0011!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Yes! Marvelous! This will be the first line of my modern chronicle! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ah, of course! Where was I then... Hmm..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.0020!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burning brightly in the bosom of Ahmtol Dits Eidos!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.003!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ah, of course! Where was I then... Hmm..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.0030!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burned brightly in the bosom of Azshu Pleez!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.004!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Was that it..? Well, where was I then... Hmm..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.0040!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burned brightly in the bosom of Empress Eidos!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.005!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ah, of course! How appropriate! Where was I then... Hmm..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.0050!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burned brightly in the bosom of Eidos, the Destroyer!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.006!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ah, of course! A perfect fit! Where was I then... Hmm..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!2.0060!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Returned unto the land of Kabu, the flame of Ark burned brightly in the bosom of Stalphos Gremlinsbane, champion of Roostor!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!3.000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Oh, sorry, was I laughing at my own jokes again? They are quite humorous, I find. Ha ha! Sorry!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!3.500!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Are you interested in some intellectual humor?"

B.response_text: "Well, if it's intellectual, I suppose it might be worth it."

D.response_text: "If you find it humorous, then I think I'll pass."

E.response_text: "Only if I get to add the punchline myself."

F.response_text: "This is no time for jokes, you silly bastard!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!3.501!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Splendid! So tell me, what do you get when you cross a Jinn with Biracul?"

D.response_text: "...How witty."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!3.503!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Oh you know, if you say 'a Jinn', it sounds like 'aging'! A Jinn, agin', get it?! HA! Ha ha! It's just too funny!"

D.response_text: "I see Biracul forgot to bring humor to Kabu..."

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!3.504!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! Humor of your own! Splendid! Though quite cruel, I dare say!"

KABU!WASTELAND!ARK'S BEACON!3.X509!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "But enough light-hearted tomfoolery! Let's get back to learning and exploring! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CANYON MOUTH!0.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The walls of a gargantuan canyon tower overhead, locked in a lengthy and ultimately futile staring match, like two brothers competing for a vacuous superiority. Their kinship likely runs deep, as every fold, every curve on one side has a corresponding protrusion or convex counterpart on the other. Torn asunder by the hands of gods, these perfectly opposing siblings now spend eternity in each other's antagonistic company.

KABU!WASTELAND!CANYON MOUTH!0.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Evidence of an ancient riverbed pours forth from the canyon as well, with water-rounded stones strewn about leading to a southern precipice. The sheer drop here is of an impressive magnitude and the long-dead waterfall that once fell from this ledge appears to have cut a path straight down to the bottom of the butte Kabu rests upon. Peering over the edge, Eidos spots a bridge halfway down uniting an incline coming out of the eastern crater with the western Wastes. Down the slope towards the east are some flatlands, bleached whiter than bones.

KABU!WASTELAND!CANYON MOUTH!0.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, the canyon mouth rudely belches dust and sand at Eidos. Fighting to stay upright, she digs her feet into the grainy floor and shields her eyes with an upraised forearm. Once the gale subsides, smaller gusts echo through the canyon like mocking laughter as the eyeless face of the canyon stares down at what it hopes will be its next meal.

KABU!WASTELAND!CANYON MOUTH!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Twists and turns, curves and folds, only up and down remain true as she passes through this simplistic, one-path labyrinth. The difficulty seems to only lie in not quitting before reaching the exit...

KABU!WASTELAND!CANYON MOUTH!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: And bold Eidos perseveres. After uncounted steps, reaching the lips of the canyon mouth in time for another violent belch of dust and sand to send her on her way. While the dust settles around her within the toothless grin of the canyon, Eidos looks out upon the landscape of utter desolation with which the Wasteland greets her. Out of the pan and into the fire, it seems.\n\n\t\tThrough the haze of blowing dust, Eidos can distinguish a solitary destination on the horizon: jagged, obsidian ridges, jutting from the sand like a crown of dark swords upon the parched skull of the Waste.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S EDGE!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: The grueling ascent ends as Eidos reaches the charred lip of the crater. While reining in her chaotic breath, she surveys the surroundings.\n\n\t\tToward the northwest, ivory pillars of salt point skyward slicing regular white bars into the cloudless gray beyond, giving the impression of a celestial prison. This forest of pillars melts away as it continues its expansion eastward toward her current location, ending suddenly at a precipitous decline just north of her - neither too high to seem daunting, nor too low to access.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S EDGE!0.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: The sun's burning heat and the Wasteland shadows' chilling cold are noticeably absent. All color has been replaced with a monochromatic veneer, blurring the lines and shadows that would otherwise define the boundaries between objects. Some fifty paces east is a drop of indeterminable height; the bottom remains shrouded by a thick blanket of colorless mist.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S EDGE!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text:
At the brink of this precipice to non-being, Eidos feels she stands in a place that is no place at all. In a place that denies existence. A narrow strip that sits between form and nothingness. Yet, her sense of thought and perception seems heightened.

		Scanning across the horizon toward the east, beyond the sea of colorless mist, she sees only the desolate flatlands spanning off into infinity. Turning south, her perception penetrates the murky gray haze and for once sees clearly the ruined towers of Ur'Ruk.

		Suddenly, a very special tower soon draws her attention. Red as blood and remarkably intact, Eidos stares at the tower, vaguely aware that something within returns her gaze.

B.response_text: Descend into the Stilled Sand Crater

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S EDGE!1.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: The grueling ascent ends as Eidos and her legions reach the charred lip of the crater. While reining in her chaotic breath, her unfazed army obediently awaits its master's orders. The deathly white draugnir legions stand in stark contrast to the Neverborn, as they chaotically pace like an excited gas cloud while ravenously drooling inky fluid; the Neverborn, on the other hand, rigidly stand in tight, orderly formations, as motionless as statues, as if frozen in time.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S EDGE!1.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Trying to determine what her subsequent course of action will be, Eidos seeks to find her bearings in this lifeless landscape. Toward the northwest, ivory pillars of salt point skyward slicing regular white bars into the cloudless gray beyond, giving the impression of a celestial prison. This forest of pillars melts away as it continues its expansion eastward toward her current location, ending suddenly at a precipitous decline just north of her - neither too high to seem daunting, nor too low to access.

Ur'Ruk now far behind her, she stops to survey her surroundings, and her unfazed army obediently awaits its master's orders. The deathly white draugnir legions stand in stark contrast to the Neverborn, as they chaotically pace like an excited gas cloud while ravenously drooling inky fluid; the Neverborn, on the other hand, rigidly stand in tight, orderly formations, as motionless as statues, as if frozen in time.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos nears the blackened stones of the ridge, she discovers the lip of a massive, pitch-colored depression in the earth, yawning like a gaping mouth reaching up to swallow the sky overhead. The crater's floor is of a darkness so absolute, so pure and uninterrupted that it more resembles a hole punched into the fabric of space, leaving only emptiness to void the fill. Nevertheless, the powdery soot displaced by her steps assures Eidos that this pseudo-void can be traversed - though no amount of scrutiny can reveal the footprints left behind.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Directly across the expansive crater to the north, pristine pillars of white jut forth from the ground like vapor jets frozen in time. At the far eastern side of this abyssal pit are towering, colorless structures, standing like waiting giants in a murky haze of hell-breathed fumes. The structures clearly belong to a damned city of some sort, walled in by the crater's ridge. Getting around the ridge would be much too difficult, so reaching this city will necessitate descending into the crater itself.\n\n\t\tTurning south, Eidos sees on her left a path winding down from where she stands to sun-lashed flatlands stretching out into infinity, and to her right a path descending toward a bridge.

C.response_text: Descend into the Stilled Sand Crater

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Moving across the void surface of the crater, Eidos proceeds robbed of sight. Though she feels silt and rock beneath her feet, she sees absolutely nothing. Every time she reluctantly lowers her eyes to the light-thieving madness of the ground, her feet hesitate before tripping into her next steps, making progress nearly impossible. Thus, with her eyes skyward, she cautiously proceeds, her feet as her sole sensors.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The deeper she dives into the crater's interior, the stronger its mephitic stench of graphite and sulfur grow, eventually seeming to sear the very skin inside her nose. The further she advances, the hotter this infernal crater becomes, not just from the sun's relentless assault, but also from some hidden internal source. Yet, sweat-drenched and blind, she proceeds.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Time adopts an unpredictable nature in this area, hovering between the recent past and the near future. Eidos begins to question whether this moment already happened or has yet to come, whether her last step preceded or postdated the current one. It is almost as through she is straddling the dimensions of space without changing her location relative to the axis of time, save a bump forward or a step back. And yet somehow this state of timelessness, of frozen moments, does not seem foreign to her. She accepts it, embraces it and walks as though this were her natural state. But try as she may, she finds it impossible to orient herself with respect to the axis of time.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Then a sharp pain rattles her nerves. Looking at the blurred contour of her hands, she sees that the heat has taken the moisture from her brain.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.005!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Face in the dirt, she desperately searches for the way back to when she was not so heatstruck and dying.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.007!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The time line appears and she travels it backwards, reversing the ill effects. Her vision returns.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!2.009!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Soon, she finds herself stumbling up an incline, then clawing her way up onto a low ledge in the crater wall that suddenly gives way to a sickly, gray light. Pockets of visible space in the blackness of the void reveals she has reached this low-lying summit and now looks out through a crack in the lip of the crater.\n\n\t\tTo the west, she sees a rough granite bridge spanning a gap left by a long-dead a waterfall. Leading in the opposite direction is a path winding down to the east and to sun-lashed flatlands stretching out into infinity.

C.response_text: Descend into the Stilled Sand Crater

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!10.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos and her retinue of Neverborn soldiers near the blackened stones of the ridge, they encounter the lip of a massive, pitch-colored depression in the earth, yawning like a gaping mouth reaching up to swallow the sky overhead. The crater's floor is of a darkness so absolute, so pure and uninterrupted that it more resembles a hole punched into the fabric of space, leaving only emptiness to void the fill. Nevertheless, the powdery soot displaced by her steps assures Eidos that this pseudo-void can be traversed - though no amount of scrutiny appears to reveal the footprints left behind.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!10.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Directly across the expansive crater to the north, pristine pillars of white jut forth from the ground like vapor jets frozen in time. At the far eastern side of this abyssal pit are towering, colorless structures, standing like waiting giants in a murky haze of hell-breathed fumes. The structures clearly belong to a damned city of some sort. Getting around the ridge would be much too difficult, so reaching this city will necessitate descending into the crater.\n\n\t\tTurning south, Eidos sees on her left a path winding down from where she stands to sun-lashed flatlands stretching out into infinity, and to her right a path descending toward a bridge.

B.response_text: Descend into the Stilled Sand Crater

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!100.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Approaching the mouth of the crater, Eidos now sees squirming pale creatures off in the distance. White and erratic, they writhe like maggots feasting on the carrion of the void as they slowly pulsate towards her. Any exact features are impossible to distinguish. In truth, they are but anti-shadows, figures dirtied by smears of warped, white flesh.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!100.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Suddenly, she is overcome with waves of pain. An ache begins to fill the pit of her stomach. An emptiness manifestS within her. It consumes the very core of her being. It eradicates her from the inside out. From space. From time. From memory.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRATER'S MAW!100.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Her awareness wanes as the pain waxes. Eidos, falls to her hands and knees, lacerating her skin with dark shards of dull graphite. Oozing out from the wounds in her flesh comes an inky fluid. She coughs up more of the deathly broth as she collapses face first into the ground. Now motes of black space eat away at her vision. The Glyphs within her mind begin to wink out of existence, as does her consciousness...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0000!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos wends her way through the twisting path of the canyon. A long warped passage, smoothed by the water that must have flowed through here once upon a dream. The rusted rock formations all about thankfully shelter her from heat and wind, though as payment they take her vision never allowing more than a fifty pace stretch of unobstructed sight. Before long, she loses all sense of direction.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00000!D.dialogue_text: Countless breaths pass her lips and countless prints leave her feet before she comes upon her first landmark in this quiet place; and it seems likely to be the last...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00001!D.dialogue_text:
Rounding a bend, the canyon widens out, setting her vision free for an unfathomable expanse in the six directions.

		Far off in the distance, the dying afternoon sun reflects off a leviathanic bridge as it slithers the span of the canyon in an uninterrupted arcing motion. Thousands of interlocking plates, shiny as polished mirrors, coat the bridge like some kind of enormous metallic serpent. Perhaps most stunning, however, is that the structure miraculously lacks any and all supports. It simply rests there as though suspended from the sky itself.

		While the canyon's western side hosts the brilliant splendor of a shining silvered spire, the eastern termination is host only to the ruined stump of its kin. The remains of the golden sister tower have long since toppled to the canyon floor, far below the bestial bridge.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00002!D.dialogue_text: Looking across the gorge, Eidos spies a series of caves honeycombing the far cliff face and a mountain of white piled on a ledge halfway down to the canyon floor, but both lie well beyond her reach...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00003!D.dialogue_text: For, while her eyes are now free to wander where they may, her feet have been sharply constrained: not far from where she stands, the canyon floor is sharply cut asunder by a second, deeper fissure in the earth's skin. Staring down from the edge, Eidos sees that the steep drop is both unclimbable and unsurvivable - evident since the bottom is consumed by the shadows of greater depths.\n\n\t\tThe recursive canyons within canyons, ripping the floor apart, insist on destroying all continuity of possible paths.

F.response_text: Attempt to descend further

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X00010!.dialogue_text: Perhaps because of her curious nature or perhaps because the Wasteland has boiled her brain into little more than a fleshy soup, Eidos feels compelled to tempt fate as she climbs down the sheer rockface.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00011!D.dialogue_text: No more than a few lengths down, Eidos' stomach sinks to her feet, burdened by the weight of a foreboding feeling...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00012!D.dialogue_text: The sound of her footholds crumbling resembles a derisive grunt, leaving her desperately clutching to the brittle rock with nothing but her fingertips.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00013!D.dialogue_text: Now anxiously clawing at the chasm wall with her feet, she desperately tries to regain her footing. The crescendoing echoes of her scratching feet turn into the cliff's boisterous and malicious cackles as her handholds separate from the wall.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.00014!D.dialogue_text: Gravity takes over, now ushering her to her final resting place an the bottom of this unforgiving fissure. The fall is long, giving her a brief moment to reflect upon her decisions, right before her Falseflesh slams into the bottom of the darkened chasm...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000100!.dialogue_text: Perhaps because of her curious nature or perhaps because the Wasteland has boiled her brain into little more than a fleshy soup, Eidos feels compelled to tempt fate as she climbs down the sheer rockface.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000101!.dialogue_text: No more than a few lengths down, Eidos' stomach sinks to her feet, burdened by the weight of a foreboding feeling...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000102!.dialogue_text: The sound of her footholds crumbling resembles a derisive grunt, leaving her desperately clutching to the brittle rock with nothing but her fingertips.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000103!.dialogue_text: The sound has caught the Daziran scholar's attention and brings him to gaze upon Eidos' crisis. But Heyar is mesmerized, locked in observation and incapable of anything but staring on in awe. It is uncertain whether he respects her courage or is simply puzzled by her bizarre decision.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000104!.dialogue_text: Now anxiously clawing at the chasm wall with her feet, she desperately tries to regain her footing. The crescendoing echoes of her scratching feet turn into the cliff's boisterous and malicious cackles as her handholds separate from the wall.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000105!.dialogue_text: Gravity takes over, now ushering her to her final resting place an the bottom of this unforgiving fissure. The fall is long, giving her a brief moment to reflect upon her decisions, right before her Falseflesh slams into the bottom of the darkened chasm...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X0002!D.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the immediate surroundings, Eidos looks about the wide shelf affording her this panoramic view.\n\n\t\tOff to the side, against the canyon wall is a simple lean-to and the ashes of a dead campfire. Further up, nearer the ledge, is a crude shrine built of dark stone. Eidos sees a small bundle of rags and cloth appears to have been placed before this altar, but a second glance betrays the form of the person hidden within the rags: an old woman lies prostrate before the holy site, remaining still as death.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.001!DES.dialogue_text: The shrine is a stump of dark granite, its glistening black surface a contrast to the rusty sandstone native to the area. From its center, a gentle stream of water flows out and down the stone itself. Nestled into three hollows, carved just above the water's exit, are three distinct objects.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0010!DE.dialogue_text: The first is an oval carved in marble of the purest white, veins of coppery green snaking through it. A simply hewn, but richly crafted black granite disk is embedded within the oval. And upon the disk, a woman in flowing robes with green spear and raised hand are depicted with such care as if to suggest she could step from the piece at any moment. The eyes in particular seem filled with life, intellect and foreboding.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0011!DE.dialogue_text: In the second hollow, a wooden plate sits propped up on its edge. Both crude and grotesque, it is whittled from worm-gnawed timber and its eating surface is painted with a black tar.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X0012!D.dialogue_text: The third and final space is filled with a metal chalice, roughly cast from pewter or its kin. It seems unremarkable in comparison to the other objects. However, it emanates an aura of danger, as if to warn Eidos never to drink from it nor any of its ilk.

A.response_text: Go back through the canyon to the Wasteland

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X0013!D.dialogue_text: The third space is filled with a metal cup, roughly cast from pewter, or its kin. It seems unremarkable in comparison to the other objects, yet emanates an aura of danger, as if to warn Eidos never to drink from its ilk.

A.response_text: Go back through the canyon to the Wasteland

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0014!DE.dialogue_text: The third space is filled with a metal cup, roughly cast from pewter or its kin. It seems unremarkable in comparison to the other objects, yet emanates an aura of danger, as if to warn Eidos never to drink from its ilk.

A.response_text: Go back through the canyon to the Wasteland

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.002!DES.dialogue_text: The the wizened hermit's corpse lies dust-covered and alone. The scent of death is all but absent, as the dry air forbids decay. Instead, a mild stench of unwashed garments wafts up from the clothes as Eidos searches.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0020!DE.dialogue_text: While at first the crone seems free of any meaningful possessions, save a simple knife, Eidos soon discovers a leather tube strung around her neck and hidden beneath her coarse shirt. Eidos removes and carefully opens the worn container, revealing a roll of dry papyrus. The cracked surface and faded letters betray its past as the well-worn prayer scroll of a fanatic Valvorthr.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0021!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos scans the worn and faded scroll, etching its letters into the near infinite library of her mind. It tells her of three trials faced by the Valvorthr, as well as of a mystical rite conferring 'life beyond death'.

A.response_text: Go back through the canyon to the Wasteland

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X500!DE.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the immediate surroundings, Eidos looks about the wide shelf affording her this panoramic view.\n\n\t\tOff to the side, against the canyon wall is a simple lean-to and the ashes of a dead campfire. Further up, nearer the ledge, is a crude shrine built of dark stone.\tThe corpse of the old crone who was here praying at the altar lies unfestering where she was slain beside it.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.500!DES.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the immediate surroundings, Eidos looks about the wide shelf affording her this panoramic view.\n\n\t\tOff to the side, against the canyon wall is a simple lean-to and the ashes of a dead campfire. Further up, nearer the ledge, is a crude shrine built of dark stone.\tThe corpse of the old crone who was here praying at the altar lies unfestering where she was slain beside it.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X000!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos comes careening down from the bridge, ever accelerating. Nearing the end of her descent, she notices an old woman kneeling at an altar directly in her path. It is far too late to try to convince gravity to alter her course and she comes crashing down upon the aged hermit...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.001!DES.dialogue_text: Brittle bones and atrophied flesh prove to be poor fall-breakers as their bodies seem to liquefy upon impact, killing both of them instantly.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos comes careening down from the bridge, ever accelerating. Nearing the end of her dive, she notices the old woman's corpse laying by the altar, right where she left it. And a mere instant later, Eidos's Falseflesh hits the canyon floor, knocking her ghost from her liquefied body.
