The cracked surface and faded letters betray its past as the well-worn prayer scroll of a fanatic Valvorthr.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!2.X9020!D.dialogue_text: Eidos scans the worn and faded scroll, etching its letters into the near infinite library of her mind. It speaks of three trials for those in the Valvorthr cult and a mystical rite conferring life beyond death.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!2.9020!DE.dialogue_text: Their conversation at its terminus, Eidos has nothing to do but return to the Wasteland... Or she could re-engage the scholar in conversation, theoretically.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!90.X000!D.dialogue_text: Though he appeared to have entered death's embrace, there is a resurgence of life in the stubborn scholar as he gasps for air, futilely clinging to life. Heyar dramatically clutches his wounds as he disappointedly gazes upon the crimson flow gushing from wound to sand. His dying body twitches and shudders in an effort to make one last, grand gesticulation as his doom draws near...

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!90.001!DE.dialogue_text: After an intolerably lengthy period of concerted effort and hyperbolic moans of agony, he manages to raise a finger, as though trying to pause a conversation, to interject a final word before he is forever silenced. Here Heyar makes his last stand against Nature and the Harbinger of his cruel fate!

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!90.002!DE.dialogue_text: Yet, his dying thoughts go mercifully unspoken as his ghost passes on into the great unknown.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!90.X003!D.dialogue_text: Turning her attention back to the surroundings, Eidos looks upon the shrine near the canyon wall. The old crone standing in front of the altar stares at Eidos in shock.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!90.X500!D.dialogue_text: Turning her attention back to the surroundings, Eidos looks upon the shrine near the canyon wall. The old crone who was here praying lies unfestering where Eidos killed her.\n\n\t\tIn that moment, Eidos notices a leather tube poke its head out from beneath the body's robes. Soon gravity has it pouring forth from her rags and emptying its contents: a roll of dry papyrus. The cracked surface and faded letters betray its past as the well-worn prayer scroll of a fanatic Valvorthr.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!90.500!DE.dialogue_text: Turning her attention back to the surroundings, Eidos looks upon the shrine near the canyon wall. The old crone who was here praying lies unfestering where Eidos killed her.

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.001!HEY.dialogue_text: "Oh, it's you! And alive at that!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.002!HEY.dialogue_text: "We appear to have both beaten the odds thus far. Here's to our continued success!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.003!HEY.dialogue_text: "Did you come to the Crescent Canyon in search of the fallen Sun Keep, as I have?"

A.response_text: "Why have you come seeking the Sun Keep?"

C.response_text: "This is just where I ended up."

D.response_text: "What secrets does this Sun Keep hold?"

E.response_text: "Didn't I tell you to leave me alone?"

F.response_text: "Only if there're gremlins there..."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.100!HEY.dialogue_text: "Why because this is a historic place!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1000!HE.dialogue_text: "The Sun Keep came crashing down to the canyon in the Age of Ark and there it lies before us!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1001!HE.dialogue_text: "The wrath of all Jinns collided with the will of the Shining One that fateful day! The fallen mage, Rikharr, returning as Jinnwraith in control of an army of draugnir!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1002!HE.dialogue_text: "And this, of course, was what sparked the creation of the Dawn Fortress and..."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1003!HE.dialogue_text: "Oh dear, I'm sorry; am I speaking too much again?"

A.response_text: "How does this relate to the present?"

D.response_text: "How did the Jinnwraith amass his army?"

E.response_text: "I wish the keep came crashing down on you."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.200!HEY.dialogue_text: "Why the Sun Keep is a historic place!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.300!HEY.dialogue_text: "Then you certainly ended up in an interesting place!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.400!HEY.dialogue_text: "There're no secrets to the keen student of history!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.500!HEY.dialogue_text: "Did you? Ha ha! Sorry! I just love talking to people. I'll just go on with my investigations!"

D.response_text: "Do so, unless you ever have anything useful to say."

E.response_text: "I wish the keep came crashing down on you."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.6000!HE.dialogue_text: "Undying and deformed, pale-skinned humanoids abominations! The aborted remains of jinnspawn!"

F.response_text: "Doubtful! But you're welcome to believe stupid fairy tales, if you want."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Yes, it's as I suspected! The Sun Keep came crashing down to the canyon in the Age of Ark and yet lies yonder before us!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.0000!HE.dialogue_text: "The wrath of all Jinns collided with the will of the Shining One that fateful day! The fallen mage, Rikharr, returning as Jinnwraith in control of an army of draugnir!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.0001!HE.dialogue_text: "And this, of course, was what sparked the creation of the Dawn Fortress and..."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.0002!HE.dialogue_text: "Oh dear, I'm sorry; am I speaking too much again?"

A.response_text: "How does this relate to the present?"

D.response_text: "How did the Jinnwraith amass his army?"

E.response_text: "I wish the keep came crashing down on you."

F.response_text: "Where's the part about the Gremlin King?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.100!HEY.dialogue_text: "The present? Why, how could the present exist as it is without the past!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.1000!HE.dialogue_text: "It's only through understanding the past that we can even begin to think about the present!"

B.response_text: "But can the past exist without the present?"

E.response_text: "We're in exile; the present is far more important now."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.200!HEY.dialogue_text: "Splendid! Where was I? Ah, yes! The inception of the Dawn Fortress!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.2000!HE.dialogue_text: "With Ark's disappearance, the remaining magi of the Valvorthr cult, led by a Daziran named Khloud, erected the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.2001!HE.dialogue_text: "Khloud was named the first mage of the Dawn Fortress, in fact. But all remaining Valvorthr mysteriously vanished!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.2002!HE.dialogue_text: "So you see, the past creates the present and that's why understanding our origins is essential!"

A.response_text: "So the Dawn Fortress was first led by a Daziran?"

B.response_text: "But can the past exist without the present?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.300!HEY.dialogue_text: "Sorry! I just believe that discussion is part of a balanced life - and the more, the better I say!"

D.response_text: "Well, the less the better, I say."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.400!HEY.dialogue_text: "Ah, well you see, that remains a mystery! He died along with the heroine Ark presumably crushed beneath this very tower - though, rumor has it, neither of their bodies were recovered! Hmm... What could this mean?!"

D.response_text: "That there's more to this story than we have been told."

E.response_text: "It means you ask too many idiotic questions..."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X500!HE.dialogue_text: "Your words are sharper than a ghelblade, Ha! But I'll keep my musings to a minimum from now on. Ha ha! Sorry!"

D.response_text: "Do so, unless what you have to say is useful."

E.response_text: "Just shut up already!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X600!HE.dialogue_text: "Well... hmm... can't say I know much about gremlins! But I shall keep my musings to a minimum. Sorry!"

F.response_text: "Only the dumb ones that don't involve gremlins, Heyar."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.101!HEY.dialogue_text: "Indeed! The current conflict between the Tacribians and the Dazirans could've been averted if more knew about the origins of the Dawn Fortress!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.1010!HE.dialogue_text: "Why I'd hazard a guess that most Tacribians don't even realize their beloved Ark was Daziran!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X1011!H.dialogue_text: "They might perhaps have more respect for the Dazirans if they knew this. Ha!"

A.response_text: "Thank you for the history lesson, Heyar."

E.response_text: "You overestimate people's capacity for reason."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.1012!HE.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you're right. Though it no longer concerns us, given that we've been cast out from civilization like body to the Valley of Bones! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X1013!H.dialogue_text: "C'mon now, let's continue our exploration, shall we?!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X201!HE.dialogue_text: "That's an odd hypothesis! Time's arrow travels in but one direction, does it not? Your current actions couldn't possibly influence the past!"

A.response_text: "I suppose you're right. Let's move on."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.2010!HE.dialogue_text: "Then history would be as malleable as the future and perhaps even MORE interesting!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.2011!HE.dialogue_text: "The mere thought of it excites me to ecstasy!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X301!HE.dialogue_text: "Hmm...  Not interested in discussion, eh? Sorry! I'll keep my musings to a minimum!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.401!HEY.dialogue_text: "Yes! I assure you there is! There always is! We must dig deeper! Ha ha! Sorry! I just get so excited when talking about these things!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.501!HEY.dialogue_text: "A pragmatist to the core, eh? Though perhaps you're right..."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.5010!HE.dialogue_text: "But we should make the best of our exile and learn as much as we can!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!2.000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Ha ha! Splendid, Heyar, splendid! They'll write songs about you for sure! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.000!KAR.dialogue_text: "The Waste is but a path and I am a mere traveler on that path! I'll not fear the Unseen of the Waste, for their deaths brin' glory to the brothers of Biracul!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0000!KA.dialogue_text: "I'll rejoice at the sight of the draugnir, for they test the sisters of Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0001!KA.dialogue_text: "I'll not turn away from the Jinns of the desert, for they're flames, catchin' the Eye that gives sight to the One!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0002!KA.dialogue_text: "Biracul, turn your Eye to me and I'll awaken from my sleep!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0003!KA.dialogue_text: "Ark, brin' me your spear and I'll make a feast for you to roast in the fire imperishable!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.0004!KA.dialogue_text: "I'll fulfill the covenant and feast on the soup of shadows! On my watch, no Jinnwraith'll ever prevail!"

A.response_text: "Don't be afraid; I mean you no harm."

D.response_text: "Your prayers have been answered. Ark has arrived."

E.response_text: "Cease this racket at once!"

F.response_text: "Allow me to join you! Hail Roostor! Buck-awk!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.100!KAR.dialogue_text: "Hmmm? Unless you be the Jinnwraith reborn, I think you no draugnir. Does an Unseen stand before me as yet untaken by the breath of nightmare?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1000!KA.dialogue_text: "No, you don't have the look of a Kaban from any township. A wayfarer then, passin' into this plane from parts unknown..."

A.response_text: "I'm not from around here. What can you tell me about this place?"

B.response_text: "What was it your were doing just now?"

E.response_text: "Tell me how I can traverse this gorge before I cast you into it."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.200!KAR.dialogue_text: "I abide here to fulfill the covenant of the Valvorthr; my time draws near, stranger."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.2000!KA.dialogue_text: "What then are you? Not a draugnir, unless you be the Jinnwraith reborn..."

A.response_text: "I'm not from around here. What can you tell me about this place?"

B.response_text: "What was it your were doing just now?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.300!KAR.dialogue_text: "The entrance to the Graylands, the Crescent Canyon where She fights the Jinns and where her Valvorthr await!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.3000!KA.dialogue_text: "... But what then are you? Not a draugnir, unless you be the Jinnwraith reborn..."

B.response_text: "What was it your were doing just now?"

D.response_text: "...I am the savior you've summoned. You look upon Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.400!KAR.dialogue_text: "Hmmm? Unless you be the Jinnwraith reborn, I think you no draugnir. Does an Unseen stand before me as yet untaken by the breath of nightmare?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.4000!KA.dialogue_text: "No, you don't have the look of a Kaban from any township. A wayfarer then, passin' into this plane from parts unknown..."

D.response_text: "...As I said! You look upon Ark! Your savior!"

E.response_text: "Tell me how I can traverse this gorge before I cast you into it."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.500!KAR.dialogue_text: "Hmmm? Unless you be the Jinnwraith reborn, I think you no draugnir. Does an Unseen stand before me as yet untaken by the breath of nightmare?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.5000!KA.dialogue_text: "No, you don't have the look of a Kaban from any township. A wayfarer then, passin' into this plane from parts unknown..."

A.response_text: "I'm indeed not from this land. What can you tell me?"

D.response_text: "...I am the savior you have summoned. You look upon Ark."

E.response_text: "Tell me how I can traverse this gorge before I cast you into it."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.600!KAR.dialogue_text: "Hmmm? Unless you be the Jinnwraith reborn, I think you no draugnir. Does an Unseen stand before me as yet untaken by the breath of nightmare?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.6000!KA.dialogue_text: "No, you don't have the look of a Kaban from any township. A wayfarer then, passin' into this plane from parts unknown..."

F.response_text: "Buck buck! Roostor, feed me with the eggs of your wisdom! Awk!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.101!KAR.dialogue_text: "You stand at a most holy site! It was on yonder bridge that the Jinnwraith Rikharr came to destroy us, and before it stands the scab left by the Sun Tower's destruction!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1010!KA.dialogue_text: "But Ark broke their forces in return, chasin' them back to the depths of the Graylands!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1011!KA.dialogue_text: "Here, I keep my vigil! At the very site of her descent! Until I'm called upon to fulfill my oath as Valvorthr!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1012!KA.dialogue_text: "And so we shall continue to do, until the return of our Lady!"

A.response_text: "What of the caves we can see from this vantage point?"

E.response_text: "So you just plan on wasting your life at this gorge?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.201!KAR.dialogue_text: "Recitin' the 'Twilight Litany'. The words to steel our hearts against the enemies of Ark and the Dawn!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.2010!KA.dialogue_text: "As Biracul watches over us from the Eye of Heaven, so too does Ark guard our souls in the Graylands!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.2011!KA.dialogue_text: "Here, I keep my vigil! At the very site of her descent! Until I'm called upon to fulfill my oath as Valvorthr!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.2012!KA.dialogue_text: "And so we shall continue to do, until the return of our Lady!"

A.response_text: "What of the caves we can see from this vantage point?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.301!KAR.dialogue_text: "There's no way! This gorge is impassable! Barred off by Ark's sacrifice to hold back the Jinn hordes of the Graylands!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.3010!KA.dialogue_text: "Descendin' from Tambul takes you no further than the Valley of Bones - lest you become lost in the death grip of the valley Jinns!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.3011!KA.dialogue_text: "You can brave the Wasteland or await the comin' of Ark here."

E.response_text: "So you just plan on wasting your life at this gorge?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.401!KAR.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, you're the Jinnwraith reborn, come to test my devotion to Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.4010!KA.dialogue_text: "By the strength of all Valvorthr before me, I will not break my covenant for a waste-born devil!"

D.response_text: "I AM Ark and you are nothing, Valvorthr!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.501!KAR.dialogue_text: "There's no way! This gorge is impassable! Barred off by Ark's sacrifice to hold back the Jinn hordes of the Graylands!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.5010!KA.dialogue_text: "Descendin' from Tambul takes you no further than the Valley of Bones - lest you become lost in the death grip of the valley Jinns!"

A.response_text: "What of the caves I can see from this vantage point?"

E.response_text: "So you just plan on wasting your life at this gorge?"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.601!KAR.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, you're the Jinnwraith reborn, come to test my devotion to Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.6010!KA.dialogue_text: "By the strength of all Valvorthr before me, I will not break my covenant for a waste-born devil!"

F.response_text: "I'm in the henhouse of darkness! Come and assert your avian power!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.102!KAR.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, in another life, in another blinkin' of the Eye, you'll walk that path. But I fear in this life it is lost to you..."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.1020!KA.dialogue_text: "Go and die in the Falseflesh, outlander."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X1021!K.dialogue_text: "If Ark guides you through the Graylands, you'll return to do what you left undone."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.202!KAR.dialogue_text: "It has been seen by the Unblinkin' Eye!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.2020!KA.dialogue_text: "Death isn't the end for a bein' like Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X2021!K.dialogue_text: "Die, and you too shall know rebirth!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.302!KAR.dialogue_text: "Go and die in the Falseflesh, outlander."

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.3020!KA.dialogue_text: "Death isn't the end for a bein' like Ark!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X3021!K.dialogue_text: "Her Valvorthr die, and they too then know rebirth!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.402!KAR.dialogue_text: "I've been tested and drunk not from the Chalice of Death!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X4021!K.dialogue_text: "Slay my Falseflesh if you wish, Ruby-tongued Jinn! But by the grace of Ark, my Trueflesh'll remain untouched!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.502!KAR.dialogue_text: "If you tire of wastin' life, destroy it!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!0.X5020!K.dialogue_text: "Destruction is but the companion of creation after all!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.001!KAR.dialogue_text: "If you're a test for the faithful, I'll pass!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.002!KAR.dialogue_text: "And if you're birthed from the void of the Graylands to wreak death upon the livin', I welcome it!"

KABU!WASTELAND!CRESCENT CANYON!1.X003!KA.dialogue_text: "For Ark guides her faithful to rebirth in the Unblinkin' Eye!"

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!1.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Carefully making her way down the sandstone slope, Eidos makes it to a bend in the path. Craning her neck skyward, she finds she runs out of flexibility long before she runs out of cliff. Slowly lying down upon the ground, she spots where the red rock meets the gray sky, its rugged edges defining their boundaries like a rusty scab bled forth from an ancient wound.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!1.001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Once again on her feet, she begins making her way around the bend. The sun, unobstructed now, cooks the ground beneath her and she finds her leg bindings make for poor armor against these burning sands. In time, her torturous steps lead her to a view of a distant mountain range. The summits of the peaks lay low, a mere handspan above the flats they tower over, dying off rather suddenly as they melt into the flats.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!1.002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Space seems to distort between her and the far-off peaks, making the distance seem to contract and expand, alternating between being close enough to touch and too far to see. The rapid changes in depth, put Eidos on unsteady legs and she begins to sway.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!1.003!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Forcing her gaze downward, Eidos regains her composure. Her eyes fill with sand as she the forsaken plain comes into focus. Between Kabu and the mountain range, there is no reprieve from the ravages of this wasted land. If anything, these flats reject life with an even greater ferocity than the Kaban wastes high above.\n\n\t\tThe earth's skin cracks and peels all about. The sun bakes what little moisture remains from the air, warping everything in sight. No animals, no plants, not even the carcasses thereof decorate this place. Even death itself seems to avoid these flats.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!1.X004!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Looking westward briefly, Eidos sees her tracks that trace back to the cliffside path, reminding her of the crater and the bridge whence she came.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!5.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Looking westward briefly, Eidos sees her tracks that trace back to the cliffside path, reminding her of the crater and the bridge whence she came.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!5.001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, what at first seems a trick of water loss, dawns in her thoughts as the presence of a Glyph - a thought confirmed by her Sigil's resonance. A brilliant white symbol now glows upon the cliff, bright enough to bring shame to the sun. Hazy, yet distinct, it almost appears to be evaporating...

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!5.002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: But soon it disappears from view and the portion of the cliff it rested upon along with it. A hidden path leads from here directly into the heart of the stone. Though, a deprivation of illumination so thorough pervades the passage that light from the exterior is immediately rejected at the aperture. Reflected upon this pitch barrier are only leaden-hued insecurities. All the phantoms of fear spawning in a simultaneous assault on the psyche.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!5.003!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Yet, Eidos remains unaffected and stalwart as she faces the unknown stretching out before her. It is as if the void beyond truly contained nothing at all and thus, no reason to fear it. Or as though the reflections were external, symptomatic of a troubled outside world. Truly a mirror of the self and not of the form. Or perhaps she fears nothing simply because she feels the choice is never hers to make, as if constantly nudged to and fro by a hand unseen. What will be, will be; and all, then, is as it should always be. Could it ever be otherwise?

A.response_text: Enter the Dungeon of the Void

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!5.010!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos steps over the threshold and into the abyss. She notices that not even the wind nor the heat of the desert dare to follow. Though the basest of natural phenomena they may be, perhaps they recognize something Eidos does not... Regardless, with her decision made, she will now be seen through to its conclusion.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!10.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Carefully making their way down the sandstone slope, Eidos and her soldiers make it to a bend in the path. KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos rushes blindly through a tunnel, sight stolen by the all-consuming darkness. Bursting through an invisible barrier, light washes over her dark-weary eyes, blinding them this time with presence rather than absence. Eyelids close and her hands rub furiously, as if begging the tears to wash away the pain. Her retinas feel like holes are slowly burning into them as blood pulses through. She wonders if she will ever see again, this time around.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Yet, as with most trials, time proves to be the best cure, and her eyes gradually adjust to the light, just as they had to the darkness. Still welling tears distort the desert shapes. Wiping, blinking, squinting, focus revisits. She sees before her expansive flats extending off towards a distant mountain range.The summits of the peaks lay low, a mere handspan above the flats they tower over, dying off rather suddenly as they melt into the flats.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Space seems to distort between her and the far-off peaks, making the distance seem to contract and expand, alternating between being close enough to touch and too far to see. The rapid changes in depth, put Eidos on unsteady legs and she begins to sway.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.003!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Forcing her gaze downward, Eidos regains her composure. Her eyes fill with sand as she the forsaken plain comes into focus. Between Kabu and the mountain range, there is no reprieve from the ravages of this wasted land. If anything, these flats reject life with an even greater ferocity than the Kaban wastes high above.\n\n\t\tThe earth's skin cracks and peels all about. The sun bakes what little moisture remains from the air, warping everything in sight. No animals, no plants, not even the carcasses thereof decorate this place. Even death itself seems to avoid these flats.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.005!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Looking westward briefly, Eidos notes the sloping cliffside path appearing to wrap around and lead upwards.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.006!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Just then, the portal leading from the dungeon seals itself, rock replacing void, and the Glyph of Awareness once branded upon it now evaporates, leaving behind only the memory of its presence.\n\n\t\tEidos looks off toward the distant mountains once more, then turning her head to the cliffside path leading in the opposite direction.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.010!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Looking westward briefly, Eidos notices for the first time her patient army awaiting her. The Neverborn automata stand in rigid, well-defined formations, unmoving and statuesque as the draugnir amble aimlessly through the space between the files, dripping inky fluid from their slackened jaws. The undying horde appears to be as large as it ever was, with members starting at the exit to the dungeon and winding all they way up and around the bend hidden by the cliff. Beyond them lies the path back toward the bridge and the crater.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!100.011!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Just then, the portal leading from the dungeon seals itself, rock replacing void, and the Glyph of Awareness once branded upon it now evaporates, leaving behind only the memory of its presence.\n\n\t\tEidos looks off toward the distant mountains once more, then turning her head to the cliffside path leading in the opposite direction.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!101.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos now returns to the flatlands and to the warped mountains lurking off in the distance. She eyes the cliff, expectantly, half-hoping to see the Glyph of Awareness reappear. Yet it does not acquiesce, remaining only a memory of her retreat from the Dungeon of the Void.

KABU!WASTELAND!FLATLANDS!102.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos now leads her undying legion to the flatlands and to the warped mountains lurking off in the distance. All halt as Eidos pauses to eye the cliff. She stares, expectantly, half-hoping to see the Glyph of Awareness reappear. Yet it does not acquiesce, remaining only a memory of her retreat from the Dungeon of the Void.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!1.X000!.dialogue_text: Crossing the bridge, the path before her appears to terminate some hundred paces off. However, upon reaching the small landing before the dead drop to unknown depths, she is gifted with a startling vision...

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!1.001!D.dialogue_text: Embedded in the side of the rock, is a thought etched in stone, albeit an amorphous and ill-formed one. The memory of times past or yet to come is written here. Yet she stands at the cusp of ignorance's foggy domain, incapable of spotting the exit confronting her through the thick, concealing mists. And ultimately what lies ahead remains a mystery to her.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!1.500!D.dialogue_text: Crossing the bridge, the path before her appears to terminate some hundred paces off. However, upon reaching the small landing before the dead drop to unknown depths, she is gifted with a startling vision...

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!1.501!D.dialogue_text: Embedded in the side of the rock, is a thought etched in stone. A pitch, a melody, a modulating harmony dances in a variegated synchrony upon her tongue and her flesh, leaving waves of goosebumps undulating in its wake. As much as her energetic Sigil itself, her very mind resonates with the Glyph of Awareness, erecting a metaphysical bridge between the two, an undeniable recognition of each other as integral parts of the whole. And in so doing, the rock wall begins to fold in on itself, in half, then in half again, halving and spiraling into an invisible terminus and revealing the passage concealed beyond.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!1.X510!.dialogue_text: Feeling compelled to pursue the path into the unknown, Eidos trusts in her instinct and leaves her will to fate. She knows not whether friend or foe awaits at the other end of this passage, but for now she has faith in the decisions made.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!1.511!D.dialogue_text: An army already in her possession, Eidos fights her inexplicable urge to re-enter the Hall of Servants in the Sanctuary. And for the briefest of instants, she feels agency, almost as though she has finally made a decision for herself...\n\n\t\tHigh on the ecstasy of self-determination, she decides to cross the bridge back towards the crater.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!10.000!.dialogue_text:
Though she steps out into the shadows of a merciful cliff, the oppressive heat of the wastes still draws beads of sweat from her pores, extracting whatever moisture it can from her to slake its own thirst. The burning dust of the Wasteland scorches Eidos' mouth and lungs, while the cloudless gray sky wraps it all as if it were a woolen blanket.

		Through the dusty veil, Eidos can see a rough granite bridge off to her left as it spans a rift in the sandstone left behind by a long-dead waterfall. The bridge seems to lead to a distant, high ridge, its towering rock formations broken and blackened, as though they were a massive crown of rotting teeth.

		Looking back over the Neverborn warriors she now leads, their impassive mien belies no feeling of discomfort. In return, they regard her only with their deadpan, yet expertly sculpted, visages, equally unyielding and stony as the sun-scorched land about her.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!50.000!.dialogue_text: Though she steps out into the shadows of a merciful cliff, the oppressive heat of the wastes still draws beads of sweat from her pores, extracting whatever moisture it can from her to slake its own thirst. The burning dust of the Wasteland scorches Eidos' mouth and lungs, while the cloudless gray sky wraps it all as if it were a woolen blanket.\n\n\t\tThrough the dusty veil, Eidos can see a rough granite bridge off to her left as it spans a rift in the sandstone left behind by a long-dead waterfall. The bridge seems to lead to a distant, high ridge, its towering rock formations broken and blackened, as though they were a massive crown of rotting teeth.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATE OF AWARENESS!100.000.dialogue_text:
Though she steps out into the shadows of a merciful cliff, the oppressive heat of the wastes still draws beads of sweat from her pores, extracting whatever moisture it can from her to slake its own thirst. The burning dust of the Wasteland scorches Eidos' mouth and lungs, while the cloudless gray sky wraps it all as if it were a woolen blanket.

		She coughs, a guttural and labored cough that seems to tie her stomach into a knot. Each time thereafter here lungs feel ever-less reluctant to allow air back in. But soon the attack subsides, and she wipes her mouth clean of the inky residue summoned up by the fit of coughs.

		Through the dusty veil, Eidos can see a rough granite bridge off to her left as it spans a rift in the sandstone left behind by a long-dead waterfall. The bridge seems to lead to a distant, high ridge, its towering rock formations broken and blackened, as though they were a massive crown of rotting teeth.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: The Gates of Dawn stand shut, their heavy, black iron doors resolute and immobile. Flanked on either side by imposing sandstone watchtowers, the slits in the side of these structures make it clear that hidden eyes peer at her from beyond. Motionless, they watch, tracking every breath, every blink of her eyes. But this path is now closed to her and thus, she turns her attention to the Wasteland breathing at her back.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.0000!DESC.dialogue_text: All about her is a landscape of lifeless desolation, dust and sand, dusty sand, and nothing but. Out in the Wastes, life lost the battle long ago and not even the bones of animals or the husks of plants remain to prove there ever was a struggle. The ground beneath her feet is a parched mosaic of cobbled gray stone, consumed by the dusty wastes where it leads. The blistering heat, distorting the air all about, makes it difficult to distinguish distant features of the land despite the clear, pale sky. Even still, two landmarks manage to catch her eye...

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.0001!DESC.dialogue_text: To the east, opposite the Kaban townships, she sees a wavering spire, seeming to melt in and out of view from the heat of the intervening sands, almost as though its very existence were uncertain.\n\n\t\tTo the southwest is a more inscrutable feature. A blackened yet reflective surface seems to alternate between stealing light and casting it back out into the desert. It has the look of a distant pool of dark water, though brief moments of clarity show that it is eerily still.

A.response_text: Head southwest to the Obsidian Ruin

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X001!DESC.dialogue_text: The Gates of Dawn stand shut, their heavy, black iron doors resolute and immobile. Flanked on either side by imposing sandstone watchtowers, the slits in the side of these structures make it clear that hidden eyes peer at her from beyond. Motionless, they watch, tracking every breath, every blink of her eyes.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X002!DESC.dialogue_text: All about her is a landscape of lifeless desolation, dust and sand, dusty sand, and nothing but. As Eidos takes in the severity of her situation, Heyar turns to look at her, a jubilant smile spread across his face. Wringing his hands with pent-up excitement, he addresses her.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X003!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos watches as Heyar walks off, the Daziran scholar gleefully muttering to himself and making strange gesticulations, as though lecturing to the dust and stones. Perhaps it is for the best they parted ways...

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos and Heyar shake hands, she can feel the Daziran scholar's sweaty palm quiver with anticipation. His grin grows so wide it seems as though his face might tear in half. Eidos withdraws her sweat-soaked hand, the faint look of revulsion on her face sculpted by instinct. But Heyar, swimming in his blissful obliviousness, has already crouched to examine the gray stones peeking out from beneath the sand, seeming to have utterly forgotten about his new companion.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X004!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos looks once more at the gates, and they simply return her gaze with their Cyclopean stare, locked in this battle of wills for an eternal instant. But Eidos budges before the gate, conceding that this path is now closed to her. Thus, she turns her attention to the Wasteland now breathing at her back.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.0041!DESC.dialogue_text: Out in the Wastes, life lost the battle long ago, and not even the bones of animals or the husks of plants remain to prove there was ever a struggle at all. The ground near the gate is a parched mosaic of cobbled gray stone, gradually consumed by dust and sand. Deeper into the Wastes, the blistering heat distorts the air all about, making it difficult to distinguish distant features of the land despite the clear, pale sky. Even still, two landmarks manage to catch her eye.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.0042!DESC.dialogue_text: To the east, opposite the Kaban townships, she sees a wavering spire, seeming to melt in and out of view from the heat of the intervening sands, almost as though its very existence were uncertain.\n\n\t\tTo the southwest is a more inscrutable feature. A blackened yet reflective surface seems to alternate between stealing light and casting it back out into the desert. It has the look of a distant pool of dark water, though brief moments of clarity show that it is eerily still.

A.response_text: Head southwest to the Obsidian Ruin

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.0045!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos stares down at the unrotting corpse of the slain scholar, mouth agape as if he wished to continue speaking even in the afterlife... She then looks up at the unyielding gates of the Dawn Fortress, realizing her only way forward is into the Wastes.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.005!DESCR.dialogue_text: Two slits split open an otherwise unbroken darkness, light and its companion pain forcing their way through. Eidos squints, trying to regulate the flow of her visual floodgates as she grows accustomed to her reawakening consciousness. She feels the rhythmic dance of her digits, her limbs, and finally her body as blood pulsates through them. Aching muscles contract uneasily, fibers sliding against each other like rusted iron rods. But eventually she manages to pry herself from the ground, kneeling on the desert sand.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X0051!DES.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Eidos feels a gentle tap on her shoulder. She spins violently towards the perceived threat, but her gaze is met with what can only be described as the antithesis of danger. Before her stands a terrified and scrawny fellow in a turquoise robe.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.0052!DESC.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Eidos feels a gentle tap on her shoulder as though to get her attention. She spins violently towards the perceived threat, but her gaze is met with what can only be described as the antithesis of danger: the scrawny Daziran scholar, Heyar.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X0053!DES.dialogue_text: The man, equally startled by Eidos' sudden movement, falls back with a weak yelp. Shaking and blinking the fear from his eyes, a look of once forgotten excitement draws the corners of his lips up into a shit-eating grin.

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!90.X000!DES.dialogue_text: Though he appeared to have entered death's embrace, there is a resurgence of life in the stubborn scholar as he gasps for air, futilely clinging to life. Heyar dramatically clutches his wounds as he disappointedly gazes upon the crimson flow gushing from wound to sand. His dying body twitches and shudders in an effort to make one last, grand gesticulation as his doom draws near...

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!90.001!DESC.dialogue_text: After an intolerably lengthy period of concerted effort and hyperbolic moans of agony, he manages to raise a finger, as though trying to pause a conversation, to interject a final word before he is forever silenced. Here Heyar makes his last stand against Nature and the Harbinger of his cruel fate!

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!90.X002!DES.dialogue_text: Yet, his dying thoughts go mercifully unspoken as his ghost passes on into the great unknown.

A.response_text: Head southwest to the Obsidian Ruin

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I spy Ark's Beacon off there to the east; quite a trip, I dare say - then again, anywhere in this strange land would be! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "I say we - you and myself, you see - tackle the Wasteland together! Your brawn and my brain might just get us through! What say you?"

B.response_text: "I lack neither brain nor brawn and will do fine on my own."

D.response_text: "I suppose it's advantageous to pool our resources..."

E.response_text: "I'll take my chances without having to babysit you."

F.response_text: "There're already enough weirdos in my party!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!0.X100!HEYA.dialogue_text: "A shame, truly! Though, I suppose I might see you around - that is, if we both survive long enough! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.000!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! You're awake now, are you? Splendid!"

D.response_text: "What've you done?!"

E.response_text: "Touch me again and it'll be the last mistake you ever make."

F.response_text: "And again I randomly wake up in some unknown location!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0010!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I spy Ark's Beacon off there to the east; quite a trip, I dare say - then again, anywhere in this strange land would be! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0020!HEYA.dialogue_text: "You mean to say you don't recall killing Khlutt, going to the Wellspring, poisoning the Tacribians and thus, condemning them to walk the Graylands for eternity?!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0021!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Well, they certainly do! Ha ha! You've been exiled to the Wasteland, old chum!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0022!HEYA.dialogue_text: "You mean to say you don't recall opening a path for the Tacribians to cross the Crescent Canyon, thus unleashing their murderous fury - no! WRATH! - down upon Dazir?! Falling like a cosmic hammer of self-righteousness to shatter a millennium of Kaban stability!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0023!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Most of Tacriba had gone to raze Dazir by the time you arrived - unconscious as you were - riding on your wave of poisoned water! But the few remaining who didn't drink your deadly cocktail immediately cast you out into the Wastes! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0024!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Now isn't that something! I might be the last living Daziran... And you the catalyst for my homeland's utter annihilation! Ha ha! What an odd couple we make!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0025!HEYA.dialogue_text: "In any event, you and I have been exiled to the Wasteland, old chum! So welcome to the great expanse of nothing! Nothing other than countless untold treasure troves of knowledge, that is!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.003!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "A desirable ability when we are but Truthseekers in exile!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.004!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! Why, it's not what I've done, but what you did!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0041!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Or don't you recall killing Khlutt, going to the Wellspring, poisoning the Tacribians - thus, condemning them to walk the Graylands for eternity!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0042!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Or don't you recall opening a path for Khlutt to cross the Crescent Canyon, thus bringing his murderous fury - no! WRATH! - down upon Dazir?! Falling like a cosmic hammer of self-righteousness to shatter a millennium of Kaban stability!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.005!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! Such ferocity! I could use a companion such as you in the Wasteland!"

KABU!WASTELAND!GATES OF DAWN!1.0061!HEYA.dialogue_text: "This is the last frontier! The finest Wasteland of our humble Kaban region! Filled to its dusty brim with knowledge!"

KABU!WASTELAND!LAND'S END!0.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos' feet beat the unforgiving ground with relentless monotony, the weariness creeping into her limbs the only reward for her trek. Yet, tirelessly she marches on, even as the landscape resists change and her destination refuses to draw nearer. The sun hangs like a white eye in a dull, gray sky, as though color itself had been burned away by its jealous gaze.

KABU!WASTELAND!LAND'S END!0.001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Wearily looking over her shoulder, Eidos sees the gate of the Dawn Fortress far behind her, now as remote and distant as her destination. The air between them visibly warps in the heat. Looking down at her hand, the distortions envelop her very skin, sucking every drop of moisture it can, slowly, patiently. Her mouth is parched. Her skin turning to tanned leather. She smells nothing but the beige dust that seems to cake her nose, mouth and garments. It will take forever to reach her destination.

KABU!WASTELAND!LAND'S END!0.003!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eternity passes in an instant, and when she next raises her head, a glint in the distance catches her sight. Peering into the burning haze, something shining midair off to the northeast greets her.\n\n\t\tTears cutting tracks down her dusty face, she strains her eyes, willing the maddening vision to right itself. Soon she can distinguish a mound, or perhaps a hill, covered in jagged cobalt-white pillars, reflecting the light of the burning disc overhead. This forest of white seems close enough to reach out and touch it; whereas, the Wasteland spire remains an elusive infinity of steps further to the east.

B.response_text: Keep walking east towards the Wasteland spire

C.response_text: Go back west to the Gates of Dawn

KABU!WASTELAND!LAND'S END!1.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: While the heat was oppressive before, it becomes positively unbearable as she begins her climb up the steep side of the rocky mound. The going becomes so steep, she is forced to pull herself along by gripping the burning stones and heaving herself up onto the plateau above...

KABU!WASTELAND!LAND'S END!2.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: It is all Eidos can do to place one foot in front of the other as her unnumbered steps draw her further and further across a landscape bereft of water, rest and reprieve.\n\n\t\tIn time, she can discern three possible locations to which she can walk from here: Ark's Beacon whence she came, a high mound of shining pillars upon a plateau and the imposing gates of the Dawn Fortress.

C.response_text: Go west to the Gates of Dawn

KABU!WASTELAND!LAND'S END!3.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: It is all Eidos can do to place one foot in front of the other as her unnumbered steps draw her further and further across a landscape bereft of water, rest and reprieve.\n\n\t\tIn time, she can discern three possible locations to which she can walk from here: a low tower leading deeper into the wastes, the high mound of shining pillars upon a plateau whence she came and the imposing gates of the Dawn Fortress.

B.response_text: Walk east to the wasteland tower

C.response_text: Go west to the Gates of Dawn

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos begins her journey across the flatlands, and towards the elusive mountains, her steps the first to grace this forgotten land in a long time.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Countless days and nights pass since leaving her birthplace far behind. Yet, an uninterrupted flow of steps pours forth from her legs, her will realized in the form of movement. She forgets all hunger, all thirst, all desire in her pursuit of the mountains.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Yet, the mountains never seem to draw any closer...

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.003!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Will fading, her muscles acquiesce to exhaustion and she collapses, unable to continue her journey.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.004!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Her deeds flashing before her eyes in an instant, she arrives at the present moment. She has been beaten and driven by forces unseen and not understood. She has been used up, wasted, like the land that will now be her grave.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.005!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: In a final act of defiance, she shifts her gaze skyward at the star-speckled blanket of night. Uncried tears well up, but do not fall, as she beholds a celestial body brilliantly etching its path across the sky.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!0.006!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: And in an eternal instant, both the observer and observed are no more.

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos and her company begin her journey across the flatlands, and towards the elusive mountains, her steps the first to grace this forgotten land in a long time.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Countless days and nights pass since leaving her birthplace far behind. Yet, an uninterrupted flow of steps pours forth from her legs, her will realized in the form of movement. She forgets all hunger, all thirst, all desire in her pursuit of the mountains.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.002!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Yet, the mountains never seem to draw any closer...

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.003!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Will fading, her muscles acquiesce to exhaustion and she collapses, unable to continue her journey. Her Neverborn sentries surround her, walling her off as best they can from the encroaching elements. They yet gaze at their fallen master, as though a child would at a dying fire. Unsure, unknowing, unprepared.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.004!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Yet her eyes are not for them. Instead, her deeds now flash before her eyes in an instant, arriving at the present moment. She has been beaten and driven by forces unseen and not understood. She has been used up, wasted, like the land that will now be her grave.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.005!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: In a final act of defiance, she shifts her gaze skyward at the star-speckled blanket of night. Uncried tears well up, but do not fall, as she beholds a celestial body brilliantly etching its path across the sky.

KABU!WASTELAND!NOWHERE!10.006!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: And in an eternal instant, both the observer and observed are no more.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos trudges across the cracked earth of the Wastes, white dust blowing all about. Slowly, the shining pool of darkness she aims for draws closer, though her increasing proximity does little to reveal its true nature. Indeed, it is not until she is nearly upon the site that she can see it for the stone it is, rather than the tenebrous liquid it purported to be.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Sunken into the ground here is a massive formation of charred, reflective obsidian. While at first it looks to be a natural formation, its sides and dimensions are too regular, its design too perfect for Nature to take the credit.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Looking down into the abyssal black of the ancient ruin, Eidos observes an infinity of concentric angles, each reflecting what little light finds its way downward. This entire formation appears to have acted as a foundation for some superstructure in times immemorial, and further inspection unveils a stairwell carved out of the shiny rock leading down into its depths.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Scanning off to the west over the edge of the ruin, Eidos sees a desiccated riverbed lying far below - likely an entrance to the adjacent canyon. It seems likely that successfully navigating this ruin might give access to a path into the Crescent Canyon.

A.response_text: Return to the Gates of Dawn

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.0000!DESC.dialogue_text: As Eidos walks down the glossy black stairs, the sound of her footfalls upon stone reflect back from all directions. The effect only becomes more pronounced as the walls encroach further around her. Every movement in this place is perilous, with razor-sharp glass threatening her from every direction. Yet, with care, she is able to descend with minimal harm.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.100!DESCR.dialogue_text: Turning towards a cracked column, Eidos looks upon a pair of burning yellow eyes. The beast is a wolf, though the darkness of its fur nearly renders the predator invisible to her eye. A guttural growl escapes its throat and its lips peel back in a snarl, revealing pearly fangs studded in ruby droplets. The menacing noise rumbles like distant thunder, vibrating blood and drool as they stream down into its matted fur.

D.response_text: Retreat back up the stairs

E.response_text: Attack the wolf

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.200!DESCR.dialogue_text: Turning towards a cracked column, Eidos looks upon a child. The youth is draped in a tattered, white garment, its green glow tempered by dull splatters of blood, as though it had been drenched in a baptism of violence. Yet for all the gore, an angelic smile remains fixed upon its delicate face, a smile belying utter joy. Eidos looks upon the face of the child and knows in her mind's eye that it innocently longs to bathe in her blood as well.

D.response_text: Retreat back up the stairs

E.response_text: Attack the child

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.300!DESCR.dialogue_text: Turning towards a cracked column, Eidos looks upon a massive creature cut from cobalt, crushing the melted glass beneath its weight. While baffled by how she could have failed to notice such a behemoth before now, it nevertheless could explain how this place met its ruin. The beast drips incandescent vapor upon the stair near Eidos' feet, cracking the glass further with unbearable heat. Brilliant spikes along the creatures back ignite in a glorious rage and soon, Eidos can feel the light of a thousand suns welling up within its carapace, gleaming white-hot.

D.response_text: Retreat back up the stairs

E.response_text: Attack the behemoth

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.400!DESCR.dialogue_text: Turning towards a cracked column, Eidos looks upon a twisted man. While he is aged and in no part fair, this wrinkled face is decayed and rotten away on one side. More terrible than his appearance is the certainty that he has appeared of his own choosing. Much of his form remains cloaked from view, and Eidos can feel the caustic effects of his corrupted soul dissolving her own. She feels terror or the Sylvan Architect, the burning desire to return to the Red Tower, a need to survive... And she knows that if she continues to stand in the presence of this abomination she will be rendered to nothing but a pile of whimpering, quivering flesh.

D.response_text: Retreat back up the stairs

E.response_text: Attack the hoary wretch

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.500!DESCR.dialogue_text: Turning towards a cracked column, Eidos looks upon a Thing. That is all she can observe for nothing stands before her, yet its presence is unmistakable. Indescribable and imperceptible in any traditional sense, like a frigid wind it is known only by its chilling effects. Eidos feels herself being rendered down into nothing, all Self simply melting away. Her Glyphs robbed from her mind and her very name annihilated in darkness. Yet, even still, this Thing, is but a shadow, a mere impression of something beyond It. Eidos can feel her mind being directed towards a Door Unseen. A Portal of Unending Night that will be her unmaking...

D.response_text: Retreat back up the stairs

E.response_text: Attack the Thing

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!0.600!DESCR.dialogue_text: Turning towards a cracked column, Eidos looks upon a singular eye, amethyst like dying, frostbitten skin. Deep green scales slither on all surfaces in a maddening strangulation as a gargantuan serpent coils itself about this place. The coursing rush of liquid draws her attention to the ancient riverbed. No longer dead and dry, it runs in a raging torrent of viscous quicksilver, toxic vapors boiling up from beyond. The leviathanic nightmare slowly draws its coils tighter, cracking the foundations all around.

D.response_text: Retreat back up the stairs

E.response_text: Attack the serpent

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.010!DESCR.dialogue_text: Scrambling frantically back to the top of the ruin, Eidos feels the sharp obsidian slice into her flesh as she attempts to escape the apparition.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.013!DESCR.dialogue_text: Halfway up the stairs, she has even forgotten to breathe.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.014!DESCR.dialogue_text: Gasping for air, she casts a panicked glance back, revealing...

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.016!DESCR.dialogue_text: Whatever she had seen within the cracked foundations is no longer visible. A second glance at her clothes and skin reveals that the lacerations were equally illusory.

A.response_text: Return to the Gates of Dawn

F.response_text: Descend the stair once more

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.018!DESCR.dialogue_text: Nothing, but the bumbling scholar, Heyar in hot pursuit, that is. But, whatever she had seen within the cracked foundations is no longer visible. A second glance at her clothes and skin reveals that the lacerations were equally illusory. Heyar simply looks at Eidos with a quizzical gaze and waits to see what she will do next.

A.response_text: Return to the Gates of Dawn

F.response_text: Descend the stair once more

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.X020!DESC.dialogue_text: Closing her eyes and breathing deeply, Eidos resolves to renew her descent. She wills the vision to be just an illusory threat, repeating to herself that it lacks substance other than what she grants it. She opens her eyes, but directs her gaze downward, and proceeds with great caution down the glossy stairs.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.021!DESCR.dialogue_text: After an insufferable march, her vision blurs. Only then does she realize she has been holding her breath the whole time. She gasps, trying to suck in every last bit of air, as though surfacing from a deep ocean dive. Looking up, she sees that the vision has disappeared. No trace remains of the creature that once menaced her.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.022!DESCR.dialogue_text: Rising to her feet, she finds that she has nearly reached the bottom and is free to walk in peace the rest of the way, troubled no longer by the dark ruin or its torments.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.025!DESCR.dialogue_text: Closing her eyes and breathing deeply, Eidos resolves to renew her descent. As if willing the vision to be just an illusory threat, she reminds herself that it lacks substance other than what she grants it. She opens her eyes, but directs her gaze downward, and proceeds with great caution down the glossy stairs. The garrulous scholar, Heyar wordlessly follows suit - though he yet mouths a silent soliloquy.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.026!DESCR.dialogue_text: After an insufferable march, her vision blurs. Only then does she realize she has been holding her breath the whole time. She gasps, trying to suck in every last bit of air, as though surfacing from a deep ocean dive. Looking up, she sees that the only eyes on her belong to the eccentric scholar. The nightmarish vision has disappeared, leaving no trace of the creature that once menaced her.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.027!DESCR.dialogue_text: Rising to her feet, she finds that they have nearly reached the bottom and that they are now free to walk in peace the rest of the way, troubled no longer by the dark ruin or its torments.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.X030!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos moves to engage the threat. However, as she steps forward, she sees that the vision has disappeared, no trace remaining of the creature that once menaced her. It has utterly vanished...

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.031!DESCR.dialogue_text: Unsure of its reality, but nonetheless unimpeded by the dark ruin's threats, Eidos renews her descent.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.035!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos moves to engage the threat, and the useless scholar, Heyar scurries back to hide behind a pillar of dark glass. However, as she steps forward, she sees that the vision has disappeared, no trace remaining of the creature that once menaced her. It has utterly vanished...

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!1.036!DESCR.dialogue_text: Unsure of its reality, but nonetheless unimpeded by the dark ruin's threats, Eidos renews her descent. The cowardly scholar quickly scuttles along to keep pace.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!10.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos returns to the obsidian stair. She ascends with vigilance, scanning for possible threats lurking among the innumerable glass pillars. Her eyes as sharp as a desert hawks, sudden motion catches her eye. Turning to face it she finds...

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!10.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Her distorted reflection peering back at her.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!10.002!DESC.dialogue_text: She cannot decide whether she is disappointed or relieved and moves, her mirror self following as she does. For the most part, however, this ruin appears to be abandoned.

KABU!WASTELAND!OBSIDIAN RUIN!10.003!DESC.dialogue_text: An appearance that proves true as she ascends the broken steps with only a few minor lacerations upon her clothes marking her passage. Once at the top, she sees the Gates of Dawn up north, off in the distance.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos descends with unwanted swiftness, the grit of granulated crystal causing her to slide uncontrollably, straight down the steep incline. A rather abrupt metamorphosis transforms the steep incline into a sheer drop, casting Eidos into a pile of loose salt below. The resulting impact sends a dull thud echoing through the rising white pillars all around her. The echoes reflect and collide, eventually enveloping Eidos in their mocking laughter.\n\n\t\tThe sound of the crash lingers in the air, but soon races away from her, and this decrescendo highlights her labored breaths. Rising from the pile, the grating sound of salt on salt again fills the environs with weak but sharp reverberations. She steps into the forest, every step, every action answered back by magnified distortions echoing off the massive pillars around her.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.0000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Her view widens to take in her environment. Yet, her vision meets nothing but the rough surfaces of the pale columns, the spaces between each pillar filled by pillars deeper into the forest. In every direction, white columns of milky crystal impede her vision. Even the sky above is obscured by the chalky giants looming over her.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.0001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: However, the stark whiteness of the scene also highlights the fine particles of black dust drifting between the milky quartzite trunks with a speed that defies the stillness of the air. These particles never settle but instead glide through space as though buoyed up by invisible currents and eddies.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.0002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The absence of unique landmarks make one direction as good as any other - though prior experience might say otherwise.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As the crunch of her footfalls reverberate through the desolate environs, it is not long before the ledge whence she began has vanished from her sight. Walking ever deeper into the forest, the canopy of salt pillars blinds her to the world outside. Even the hour of day is lost to her, yet all is illuminated, as the ghostly stone shapes around reflect light from sources unseen.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Then, Eidos' vision blurs and her stomach churns. The world starts to spin. Her very thoughts seem to fade, as if slowly eroding in an unseen current. While her surroundings now seem cast in even starker relief, the Glyphs within her mind feel more distant and more difficult to recall...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: But soon, this revolting sensation passes and she regains her focus, forcing the sense of irrecoverable loss to the depths of her mind. She stands up, not remembering having fallen, and wipes the dark vomit from her mouth, not remembering having wretched.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.0002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Looking around, Eidos finds no directional logic to the place. North and south might as well be pointing the same way and east-west could arguably be pointing in at each other. The unending files of white clones and their unnerving stillness give the impression she is traversing a frozen mote of time - an illusion betrayed only by the movement of her mind, the sound of her breath, and swirling black dust all around.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As the crunch of her footfalls reverberate through the desolate environs, it is not long before the ledge whence she began has vanished from her sight. Walking ever deeper into the forest, the canopy of salt pillars blinds her to the world outside. Even the hour of day is lost to her, yet all is illuminated, as the ghostly stone shapes around reflect light from sources unseen.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.900!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Though utterly lost and unsure where to go, an unscalable salt shelf to her left leaves only forward or right as viable options...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.X901!DESCR.dialogue_text: However, before she can decide where to head next, she becomes aware of a sound off in the distance that is not an echo of her footsteps. Directly ahead of her, she hears a strange, whimpering wail.

A.response_text: Go forward towards the crying sound

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!10.9010!DESCR.dialogue_text: However, before she can decide where to head next, she becomes aware of a sound off in the distance that is not an echo of her footsteps. Directly ahead of her, she hears a strange, whimpering wail... Yet, she feels as if it were immaterial, eldritch and ultimately impossible. Though Eidos clearly hears the sound, she recognizes it as expectation, as a mere echo of a memory and nothing more.

A.response_text: Go forward towards the memory of the crying sound

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!20.903!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Then she sees the fresh tracks in the salt leading off to her right...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!20.904!DESCRI.dialogue_text: She is not alone; someone or something else wanders this forest with her...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!20.X905!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos stills her breathing, enlisting silence as an ally to highlight the noisy crunch of any nearby footfalls. Evidence of a second lurker comes in the form of a strange, whimpering wail.

C.response_text: Head right towards the sound of footsteps
