KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!30.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As the crunch of her footfalls reverberate through the desolate environs, it is not long before the ledge whence she began has vanished from her sight. Walking ever deeper into the forest, the canopy of salt pillars blinds her to the world outside. Even the hour of day is lost to her, yet all is illuminated, as the ghostly stone shapes around reflect light from sources unseen.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!30.903!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Then she spots the fresh tracks in the salt...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!30.904!DESCRI.dialogue_text: She is not alone; someone or something else wanders this forest with her.

B.response_text: Go straight towards the unseen wanderer

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos swims through the interminable sea of white, following the tragic melody of the ghostly wail. Yet, no matter how far she goes, it never seems to get louder, always sounding like nothing more than a dying echo of a long-finished song...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: With each labored step, her sickness deepens. With every pulse of her heart, her Glyphs seem to wink in and out of her awareness, walking the thin line of existence. Now, the motes of black dust do not change in shape or size, only in definition. As though holes burned into her very vision, they scatter light in their wake, endlessly spinning within her sight.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.0002!DESCR.dialogue_text: But Eidos bears it. Now forgetting what she has lost, she coughs and grits her teeth. Focusing her thoughts, she then presses on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.X0003!DESC.dialogue_text: Weary feet drag lines into the thickening mounds of salt; footprints become amorphous dimples in the grainy white powder. Pillar after indistinct pillar pass her by on her way to nowhere. But suddenly she passes one of the myriad salt pillars, and the melancholy wail that once permeated the air now ceases. A figure huddled up next to the pillar comes into view...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.0004!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos looks upon the pathetic form of a bare-skinned female, voicelessly whimpering to herself. The woman's pale skin is frosted, as though touched with the chill of winter, despite the ambient heat of the forest air. She averts her gaze from Eidos, allowing the thin strands of her crystal white hair to cascade down the curves of her body.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.0005!DESCR.dialogue_text: Yet, a mystery remains, the mystery of how her silent laments resonated with Eidos, reaching her despite the great distance that once separated them. The creature's mind and Eidos' seemed to share some bizarre and primordial link, a link shared by every pillar in the forest however weak it may be.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.0006!DESCR.dialogue_text: Weary feet drag lines into the thickening mounds of salt; footprints become amorphous dimples in the grainy white powder. Pillar after indistinct pillar pass her by on her way to nowhere. But suddenly she passes one of the myriad salt pillars, and the melancholy wail that once permeated the air now ceases.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.00060!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos turns to look upon the suspicious pillar, noting that within it lies a familiar yellow crystal, fully illuminate but subdued by the white salt casing of the pillar itself. A memory of a wretched and dying creature floods Eidos' mind, recognizing her impossible sacrifice. A life for a life, yet they both live.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos swims through the interminable sea of white, following the tragic melody of the ghostly wail. Yet, no matter how far she goes, it never seems to get louder, always sounding like nothing more than a dying echo of a long-finished song...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.502!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Momentarily, her focus shifts to the motes of black dust drifting aimlessly through the air. They do not change in shape or size, only in definition. As though they were holes burned into her vision, they scatter light in their wake as they spin endlessly through the snow-white salt. Their random dance absolutely mesmerizes Eidos. She stares and she stares until she halts, standing among the dark snow that refuses to fall. Time stops for the briefest of moments as she begins to forget.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.503!DESCRI.dialogue_text: First, a perfect stillness of body, a simulacrum of non-existence within the realm of existence.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.504!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Subsequently, an utter fragmentation of thought, a likeness of chaos within the order of her mind.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.507!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The most genuine of all freedoms.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.508!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A crack. A crash. The downpour of salty grit and fine dust snaps her back to the reality of the Wasteland. Focusing her thoughts, she presses on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.X509!DESCR.dialogue_text: Weary feet drag lines into the thickening mounds of salt; footprints become amorphous dimples in the grainy white powder. Pillar after indistinct pillar pass her by on her way to nowhere. But suddenly she passes one of the myriad salt pillars, and the melancholy wail that once permeated the air now ceases. A figure huddled up next to the pillar comes into view...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.5090!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos looks upon the pathetic form of a bare-skinned female, silently whimpering to herself. The woman's pale skin is frosted, as though touched with the chill of winter, despite the ambient heat of the forest air. She averts her gaze from Eidos, allowing the thin strands of her crystal white hair to cascade down the curves of her body.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.5091!DESCR.dialogue_text: Yet, a mystery remains, the mystery of how her silent laments resonated with Eidos, reaching her despite the great distance that once separated them. The creature's mind and Eidos' seemed to share some bizarre and primordial link, a link shared by every pillar in the forest however weak it may be.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.510!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Weary feet drag lines into the thickening mounds of salt; footprints become amorphous dimples in the grainy white powder. Pillar after indistinct pillar pass her by on her way to nowhere. But suddenly she passes one of the myriad salt pillars, and the melancholy wail that once permeated the air now ceases.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.511!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos turns to look upon the suspicious pillar, noting that within it lies a familiar yellow crystal, fully illuminate but subdued by the white salt casing of the pillar itself. A memory of a wretched and dying creature floods Eidos' mind, recognizing her impossible sacrifice.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.512!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A life for a life, and yet... they both live.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.513!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Though Eidos cannot understand it, she knows it to be true. The memory is real, but still just a memory, an untouchable reality of some distant past or unreachable future.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.610!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos steps forward, its withered head turns to look upon her with a featureless visage. A blank, eyeless face seemingly gazes at her with a vacant stare. Eidos can feel a sense of panic, a terror brewing in the air all around her. A palpable sense of impending doom reverberates through the minerals like an unvoiced wail. Only then does Eidos realize...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6100!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos herself is the source of this creature's overwhelming dread.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.X6101!DESC.dialogue_text: Only then does Eidos begin to perceive that the emotions rippling through this space are sourced in the salt pillar before her, a slender yellow crystal now apparent within, its light pulsing humbly as the dying embers of a fire would.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6102!DESCR.dialogue_text: Only then does Eidos begin to perceive that the emotions rippling through this space are sourced in the salt pillar before her, a slender yellow crystal now apparent within, its light pulsing humbly as the dying embers of a fire would.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.630!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos pitilessly looks away from the creature, seeking a path to banish it to the forgotten memories of the past.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.650!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos steps forward, its withered head turns to look upon her with a featureless visage. A blank, eyeless face seemingly gazes at her with a vacant stare. Eidos can feel a sense of panic, a terror brewing in the air all around her. A palpable sense of impending doom reverberates through the minerals like an unvoiced wail.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.611!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos opens her mouth to speak, a final flash of amber light signals the crystal's end, and along with it the apparition vanishes, phasing from existence and into memory. Eidos now stands alone in the swirling black dust of the Salt Forest.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.621!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will and will becomes thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6210!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos senses the disintegration within the crystalline structure as her Techne reaches out to it. Resurrection now superficially unravels the threads of entropy, reversing the end fate had tragically woven for this creature...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6211!DESCR.dialogue_text: But nothing comes without a price, and reviving a life requires an equal sacrifice.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6212!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos feels the pervading sense of fear and doom within the creature subside. With her waking eyes, Eidos sees the once pathetic and withered female regain her beautiful face and form, while her mind's eye can sense the shards of thought within the creature fusing, remembering itself as the arclight it always has been. Now draped in shining crimson samite and curls of equally crimson hair, the arclight gazes about the Salt Forest, its mind racing with memory. When its gray eyes fall upon Eidos, she thinks she sees tears streaming down its serene face. But upon its complete transformation, the creature now fades from view and into memory.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6213!DESCR.dialogue_text: A life for a life, Eidos' sacrifice lives on in the thought of those who survive her. Her shell now withers as a dying flower, and her ghost flies forth from its shell...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.631!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will and will becomes thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6310!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos senses the disintegration within the crystalline structure as her Techne reaches out to it. Like sap from ancient tree, energy slowly flows from the crystalline mound, revitalizing a weathered and weary Eidos.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.6311!DESCR.dialogue_text: As the final drop of energy falls into the pool of Eidos' Falseflesh, the apparition of the strange female abruptly vanishes, phasing out of existence and into memory. With the life-blood of the creature now consumed, Eidos is left standing alone in the swirling black dust of the Salt Forest.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.651!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Before Eidos can draw back to deal an initial attack on the creature, a final flash of amber light signals the crystal's end, and along with it the apparition vanishes, phasing from existence and into memory. And so now she stands alone in the swirling black dust of the Salt Forest.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.900!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Before Eidos can move, horrific pain grips her now rotting lungs. Unconsciously, Eidos looks away from the creature, desperately seeking a path to escape its presence. As she coughs up a bilious, black fluid, she cannot help but feel this forest ghoul is responsible for her ever-intensifying suffering.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!11.901!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, horrific pain grips Eidos' now rotting lungs. Unconsciously, Eidos looks away from the pillar, desperately seeking a path to escape its presence. As she coughs up a bilious, black fluid, she cannot help but feel this wretched crystal is responsible for her ever-intensifying suffering.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: With each labored step, her sickness deepens. With every pulse of her heart, her Glyphs seem to wink in and out of her awareness, walking the thin line of existence. Now, the motes of black dust do not change in shape or size, only in definition. As though holes burned into her very vision, they scatter light in their wake, endlessly spinning within her sight.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: But Eidos bears it. Now forgetting what she has lost, she coughs and grits her teeth. Focusing her thoughts, she then presses on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: In time, she spots something that strikes her wearied mind: tracks. Someone or something has clearly dragged their unruly feet through here recently.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.0002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos follows the parallel lines punctuated by heavy dimples for only a short time before happening upon their maker. Standing with its back to her, is the form of a man, skin paler than the salty pillar he leans against. His tattered traveling cloak cannot disguise the shape of armor beneath. His arm, outstretched, grips a salt mound for stability as he stains with inky drool the white powder beneath him.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.0003!DESCR.dialogue_text: He seems oblivious of Eidos - or at least indifferent to her - and indeed, but for his upright posture, it would appear as though he might be dead, frozen there in space and time. No sound of breath emanates from the silent figure, neither does she detect any visible pulsations of a breathing chest cavity.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos swims through the interminable sea of white, the crunch of her steps announcing her presence throughout the desolate environs. Passing countless identical pillars, she begins to feel even more lost than before. But fortune has not abandoned her entirely, for soon she finds a reference in this land of similarity; soon she spots tracks. Someone or something has clearly dragged their unruly feet through here recently.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Before Eidos can react to the silent figure, a female warrior darts out from behind a pillar. Her raiment mirrors that of the strange man before her, cloak and armor of equal wear, yet the vitality of her motion and the healthy glow of her skin stand in stark contrast to the lifeless man before them.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The two are, however, similar insofar as their utter ambivalence to Eidos' presence. Their business evidently precludes caring about the surroundings, and the warrior duo intends to conduct said business regardless of the circumstances.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.X102!DESCR.dialogue_text: Icy cold stares not enough for the newcomer, she lets her voice ring out in the stillness of the Salt Forest, as she approaches the pillar.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.800!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos clumsily follows as the Tacribian ranger waltzes effortlessly between the pillars. Fwayya neither speaks nor breaks her stride as she follows tracks in the salt with unerring certainty.\n\n\t\tSoon, Eidos is limping, her condition worsening with each step, and thus, the distance between them grows.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8000!DESCR.dialogue_text: But before Eidos loses sight of her, the warrior halts having come upon an individual donning equipment mirroring her own. Yet, something about this creature standing before them is amiss. Scrutiny reveals that tears in its clothes expose secrets hidden underneath. Sickly skin, the pallor of which makes the salt envious. Soon she likewise notes the unnatural stillness of the individual. Utterly breathless, motionless, lifeless it stands, propped up against a salty column with an outstretched arm, leaking a bilious, black fluid onto the sand below...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.X8001!DESC.dialogue_text: The former Tacribian ranger Fwayya sought now stands before them. She then approaches the pillar and begins to speak.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.X801!DESCR.dialogue_text: The silent warrior turns its head, showing Eidos the very face of the void. The deathly pallor of his complexion is chalk-white, though deep, dark smudges run from his lips and nose streaking down his skin like ink spilled upon blank paper. And the whites of his eyes have entirely metamorphosed into a milky membrane thinly stretched over hardened black orbs.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.802!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Fwayya produces an amber crystal from the folds of her cloak. She draws her hand back with clear intent to launch the crystal...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.803!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Fwayya accelerates the crystal, just as abruptly, releasing her grip, and sends it speeding towards Shen's pillar.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8031!DESCR.dialogue_text: In an instant, an expanding sphere of energy illuminates the forest, consuming everything in its wake. The pillars, the draugnir, the interloper, everything.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8032!DESCR.dialogue_text: But its unbridled growth desists just before reaching Eidos, giving way, instead, to a cataclysmic collapse.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8033!DESCR.dialogue_text: The sudden expansion and contraction throw the surrounding air into a chaotic frenzy, birthing myriad rippling shock waves out in the six directions.\n\n\t\tThe initial burst propels Eidos up against a salt pillar, knocking the wind from her lungs. Then, wave upon wave of superheated air crashes over her, squeezing the liquid from her organs and boiling it at once. But soon the blast’s effects wane, and gravity finally reels her back down onto the ground.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8034!DESCR.dialogue_text: Bloodied, but alive, Eidos' blurry vision begins to recover its sharpness.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8035!DESCR.dialogue_text: She first notices the inky-black fluid oozing onto her hands from every opening in her face. Suddenly, she feels her insides twist and warp as though trying to strangle themselves. Her rotten innards seem to liquefy from the wringing, and now only the welcomed relief of death could placate her.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8036!DESCR.dialogue_text: Bringing her hand from her abdomen toward her face, she observes that her nails have become crusted and stained, as though she had dipped her festering fingertips in crude oil.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8037!DESCR.dialogue_text: A sudden swell of crushing agony brings her collapsing into the salt.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8038!DESCR.dialogue_text: Motes of black space eat away at her vision, blotting out all light. Her consciousness wanes as the pain waxes.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8039!DESCR.dialogue_text: Then, the moment when her Falseflesh and ghost part arrives...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.804!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Fwayya lowers her arm and looks towards Eidos with an expression devoid of all emotion save the most pristine distillation of aggravation and regret. Tucking the crystal back into her robe, the Tacribian turns and dashes behind a pillar, and with blinding speed, vanishes.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8040!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos then turns to look upon the ruined form of Shen, and recognizes something familiar. Black flecks behind his eyes. The same as those she sees within her own eyes. A twisting pain fills her stomach and the Glyphs in her mind are erased, first from her thoughts, then from her memory itself.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8041!DESCR.dialogue_text: She coughs, quickly covering her mouth. Lungs burn. Soon, a hot, inky-black fluid oozes onto her hands from every opening in her face. She sees her hands; the nails have become crusted and stained, as though she had dipped her festering fingertips in crude oil.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8042!DESCR.dialogue_text: Suddenly, she feels her insides twist and warp as though trying to strangle themselves. Her rotten innards seem to liquefy from the wringing, and now only the welcomed relief of death could placate her.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8043!DESCR.dialogue_text: A sudden swell of crushing agony brings her crashing face first into the salt. So great is the pain, she forgets how to think.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8044!DESCR.dialogue_text: Her consciousness wanes as the pain waxes.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8045!DESCR.dialogue_text: Then, the moment when her Falseflesh and ghost part arrives...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.805!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Fwayya lowers her arm. She looks towards Eidos with an expression devoid of all emotion save the most pristine distillation of aggravation and regret. Eidos can see flecks of black matter in the whites of the Fwayya's eyes, as though the blood vessels below were filling with graphite.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8050!DESCR.dialogue_text: Tucking the crystal back into her robe, Fwayya turns and dashes behind a pillar, and with blinding speed, vanishes.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.8051!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos then turns to look upon the ruined form of Shen. Stilled within the Salt Forest, he makes no motion. He appears utterly unaware of his surroundings and stands among the white columns, all but dead, almost as though attempting to will himself out of existence.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.900!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos chases after the warrior as she effortlessly waltzes between the pillars, leaving tracks in parallel to a third and more slovenly set headed in the same direction.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9000!DESCR.dialogue_text: When Eidos finally catches up to her, it is because Fwayya has halted. Before then stands an individual donning equipment mirroring Fwayya's. Yet, something about this creature standing before them is amiss. Scrutiny reveals that tears in its clothes expose secrets hidden underneath: sickly skin, the pallor of which makes the salt envious. Soon she likewise notes the unnatural stillness of the individual; utterly breathless, motionless, lifeless it stands, propped up against a salty column with an outstretched arm, leaking a bilious, black fluid onto the sand below...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.X901!DESCR.dialogue_text: Before Eidos can do anything, the female warrior's voice rings out in the stillness of the Salt Forest as she approaches the pillar.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.X902!DESCR.dialogue_text: The silent warrior turns its head, showing Eidos the very face of the void. The pallor of his complexion is chalk-white, though deep, dark smudges run from his lips and nose streaking down his skin like ink spilled upon blank paper. And the whites of his eyes have entirely metamorphosed into a milky membrane thinly stretched over hardened black orbs.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9020!DESCR.dialogue_text: Fwayya produces an amber crystal from the folds of her cloak. She draws her hand back with clear intent to launch the crystal...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.904!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Fwayya accelerates the crystal, just as abruptly, releasing her grip, and sends it speeding towards Shen's pillar.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9041!DESCR.dialogue_text: In an instant, an expanding sphere of energy illuminates the forest, consuming everything in its wake. The pillars, the draugnir, the lady ranger, everything.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9042!DESCR.dialogue_text: But its unbridled growth desists just before reaching Eidos, giving way, instead, to a cataclysmic collapse.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9043!DESCR.dialogue_text: The sudden expansion and contraction throw the surrounding air into a chaotic frenzy, birthing myriad rippling shock waves out in the six directions.\n\n\t\tThe initial burst propels Eidos up against a salt pillar, knocking the wind from her lungs. Then, wave upon wave of superheated air crashes over her, squeezing the liquid from her organs and boiling it at once. But soon the blast’s effects wane, and gravity finally reels her back down onto the ground.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9044!DESCR.dialogue_text: Bloodied, but alive, Eidos' blurry vision begins to recover its sharpness. Then, slowly, she regains control of her digits. Then, her limbs.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!21.9045!DESCR.dialogue_text: Soon, she rises and surveys the damage. Not a trace is left of the two beings consumed by the light. Though even more unnerving is that the only evidence of an explosion is the distinct lack of pillars in that area. Other than that, the immaculate whiteness remains, unperturbed.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos swims through the interminable sea of white, following the dimples made in the thick sand by some Wasteland interloper. The distance between the tracks suggests a sprint. Yet, soon the stride contracts as they come upon a second set. These new tracks consist of parallel lines punctuated by heavy dimples closely spaced.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Merging like tributaries of a river desperate to reach the sea, the tracks shift downhill, off toward the left. Swept up in the flow of footprints, she lets the tracks carry her toward their makers.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: With each labored step, her sickness deepens. With every pulse of her heart, her Glyphs seem to wink in and out of her awareness, walking the thin line of existence. Now, the motes of black dust do not change in shape or size, only in definition. As though holes burned into her very vision, they scatter light in their wake, endlessly spinning within her sight.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.0002!DESCR.dialogue_text: But Eidos bears it. Now forgetting what she has lost, she coughs and grits her teeth. Focusing her thoughts on the task at hand, she presses on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.0003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Weary feet drag lines into the thickening mounds of salt. Footprints become amorphous dimples in the grainy white powder. A cough. Blackened phlegm spat onto the ground. She looks down, suddenly realizing those weary feet are hers, the footprints too. Yet still she moves in pursuit of a forgotten goal...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Pillar after indistinct pillar pass her by on her way to nowhere. Chasing the interminable trail of footprints, the heavy crunch of her footsteps announces her presence throughout the desolate environs, as though begging to be found.\n\n\t\tHer pleas fall on alert ears further down the path of prints. There, the forgotten Wasteland interloper examines the trail. Eidos shambles nearer, soon reaching the form of a crouching woman, decked in light armor and a tattered cloak.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.X501!DESCR.dialogue_text: In the space of a thought, the warrior, calm but dynamic, looks up and in a single flowing motion, rises and unsheathes her blade.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.X502!DESCR.dialogue_text: Fwayya turns on her heel and dashes deeper into the forest.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!31.503!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Fwayya turns on her heel and leads Eidos further into the forest.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Layers upon layers of perfectly aligned and utterly indistinguishable pillars jut skyward in this endless forest. Yet, a difference now emerges...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Ever so subtly, the diffused light intensifies, as if this impenetrable wall of salt giants had grown thin. The pillars glow with ever-increasing radiance as Eidos pushes on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: After uncounted steps and innumerable dimples in the salt, ephemeral markers of her passage, Eidos reaches a break in the forest. Laid out before her, a path descends through weakening lattices of white mineral into an opening far below. But, then...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.005!DESCRI.dialogue_text: An ache begins to fill the pit of her stomach, as if the emptiness manifesting within her had finally begun to consume the core of her being. Her Glyphs recede into an infinite distance, blinking out of sight, out of mind, out of existence...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.007!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Clutching her swollen abdomen, she rips into the skin with the strength of her grip, staining her fingernails like ink-dipped quills.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.008!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A swell of crushing agony brings her collapsing into the salt, staining it with the sooty broth she expectorates from her dissolving lungs.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.009!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Her awareness wanes as the pain waxes. Motes of black space mockingly eat away at her vision and the Glyphs within her mind completely disappear...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Layers upon layers of perfectly aligned and utterly indistinguishable pillars jut skyward in this endless forest. Yet, a difference now emerges...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.501!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Ever so subtly, the diffused light intensifies, as if this impenetrable wall of salt giants had grown thin. The pillars glow with ever-increasing radiance as Eidos pushes on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!12.502!DESCRI.dialogue_text: After uncounted steps and innumerable dimples left in the salt, ephemeral markers of her passage, Eidos reaches a break in the forest. Laid out before her, a path descends through weakening lattices of white mineral into an opening far below. Yet, to her right, there appears to be more forest to explore.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Layers upon layers of perfectly aligned and utterly indistinguishable pillars jut skyward in this endless forest. Yet, an aural anomaly suddenly emerges...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Echoing waves of crystal grating on crystal pours forth from no more than a hundred paces forward. It sounds as though there were a cascade of salts crashing down upon the ground, the falling crystals crunching with the weight of the impact. Eidos cautiously approaches the crystalline cataract and soon she knows its true nature.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A number of creatures are gathered at the base of a salt pillar. They appear to be some sort of crystalline arachnids, each about two handspans in diameter. Transparent in color, it is as though they were spun from glass, though milky strands crash like waves throughout their bodies. The organisms crawl over each other and jostle, looking for an opportunity to chew away at the mineral column where they are gathered.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Looking within the salt, Eidos detects a faint image: a withering body, red-haired, female, trapped inside the icy pillar. But then...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Layers upon layers of perfectly aligned and utterly indistinguishable pillars jut skyward in this endless forest. Yet, an aural anomaly suddenly emerges...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.501!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Echoing waves of crystal grating on crystal pours forth from no more than a hundred paces forward. It sounds as though there were a cascade of salts crashing down upon the ground, the falling crystals crunching with the weight of the impact. Eidos cautiously approaches the crystalline cataract and soon she knows its true nature.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.502!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A number of creatures are gathered at the base of a salt pillar. They appear to be some sort of crystalline arachnids, each about two handspans in diameter. Transparent in color, it is as though they were spun from glass, though milky strands crash like waves throughout their bodies. The organisms crawl over each other and jostle, looking for an opportunity to chew away at the mineral column where they are gathered.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.503!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Looking within the salt, Eidos detects a faint image: a withering body, red-haired, female, trapped inside the icy pillar. As Eidos looks upon the image, she feels a resonance with her Glyph.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.510!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will and will becomes thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.5100!DESCR.dialogue_text: Calling the Glyph of Fenrir to mind, Eidos draws forth from the pillar the congealed mass of energy, like liquid amber from a fossilized plant. As the flow of light breaks the surface, the arachnids lap up their fill; and as the crystal's energy is spent, the image of the female within fades completely from view. With no more sustenance to be consumed, the crystalline spiders simply scurry away.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.5101!DESCR.dialogue_text: Looking about, Eidos notes that there are several different directions in which she could proceed.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.511!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Averting her dispassionate gaze from the feasting creatures, Eidos notes that there are several different directions in which she could proceed.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!22.512!DESCRI.dialogue_text: With a mere kick from her boot, Eidos cracks a number of the fragile creatures and sends the rest of the crystalline spiders scurrying away. Detecting what may be a fleeting look of gratitude on the face of the female within, it fades from view, and the amber crystal within pulses gently with life.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!32.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Layers upon layers of perfectly aligned and utterly indistinguishable pillars jut skyward in this endless forest. Yet, a difference now emerges...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!32.501!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Ever so subtly, the diffused light intensifies, as if this impenetrable wall of salt giants had grown thin. The pillars glow with ever-increasing radiance as Eidos pushes on.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!32.502!DESCRI.dialogue_text: After uncounted steps and innumerable dimples left in the salt, ephemeral markers of her passage, Eidos reaches a break in the forest. Laid out before her, a path descends through weakening lattices of white mineral into an opening far below. Yet, to her left, there appears to be more forest to explore.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos makes a final push forward, slogging through ever-thickening wind-drifted salt dunes. Soon, however, it looks as though she reaches the limits of the Salt Forest. A dense collection of overlapping crystalline structures in this place presents a seemingly impassable barrier, some hundred paces wide. At its extremes, the barrier is abetted by two slopes connecting to paths exiting the forest. Both paths appear to offer no obvious chance of reentry into the forest, as they involve drops to lower elevations...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos makes a final push forward, slogging through ever-thickening wind-drifted salt dunes. Soon, however, it looks as though she reaches the limits of the Salt Forest. A dense collection of overlapping crystalline structures in this place presents a seemingly impassable barrier, some hundred paces wide. At its extremes, the barrier is abetted by two slopes connecting to paths exiting the forest. Both paths appear to offer no obvious chance of reentry into the forest, as they involve drops to lower elevations...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.501!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly, an eldritch feminine form materializes from the ether, its red hair vibrant and effulgent. The creature enters the crystalline barrier, dissolving it from within. Myriad minuscule salt particles pour forth from its center, leaving an aperture large enough to crawl through.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.X002!DESCR.dialogue_text: As she walks the path, she notices the curious remains of a humanoid entangled, or somehow fused with a being clearly not of nature's design. Whatever may have transpired here, the surroundings seem unaffected and it is as though this unified creature were simply placed here as an afterthought.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0020!DESCR.dialogue_text: Continuing down the path ever-further, Eidos witnesses something most remarkable: supported within an elegant, metallic structure is a crimson crystal, brilliantly and invitingly casting its rays in playful competition with the sun.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0021!DESCR.dialogue_text: Softly brushing her fingers across the radiant surface, Eidos catches a hint of the crystal's contents. The start of her story, from the middle, only to truly begin at the end, and the end being only the beginning. It seems senseless, paradoxical and utterly confusing from a flat, unidimensional perspective. But Eidos now begins to see that her present actions are only possible due to work done long ago, and that the actions of the past were only possible because of what she now does...

F.response_text: Destroy the crystal

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0022!DESCR.dialogue_text: Coaxing the energy from the crystal, Eidos fills herself with the knowledge and wisdom of the past, in preparation to grant it anew to her forebearers at a future juncture. Drinking deeply from the crystalline font, its energy fades and she assimilates it all into her Trueflesh. She consumes until the very last drop reunites with its origin in Eidos.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0023!DESCR.dialogue_text: The crystal, now inert, decomposes into dust from the burden of millennia of existence in a harsh and unforgiving Wasteland...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.X0024!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos kicks the crystal from its casing, sending it flying towards one of the calcified walls. Upon the fateful meeting of these two fragile, yet rigid surfaces, a tinkling series of cracks fill the air. However, Eidos is not long disturbed by this destructive melody, as she is nearly instantly incinerated when the energy pent up within the crystal washes over the area...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0025!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos kicks the crystal from its casing, sending it flying towards one of the calcified walls. Upon the fateful meeting of these two fragile, yet rigid surfaces, a tinkling series of cracks fill the air. However, Eidos is not long disturbed by this destructive melody, as the energy pent up within the crystal washes over the area...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0026!DESCR.dialogue_text: But with Luin keeping its oath of protection, the heat does not boil her blood and melt her skin as it had hoped. Yet, the force of the explosion-displaced air does manage to hurl her through the opposite wall and out into the a darkened pit.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Crystalline dust lies in a pile at Eidos' feet; it is all that remains of the once vibrant flame that burned within. What is left for Eidos now is only to proceed in the direction of her choice.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.0030!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos thus returns down the path to where she once saw the brilliant crystal emitting crimson rays of luminescence from its core. Its consumption leaves only an unaccompanied chimera of fused humanoid and monstrosity, silently observing for the remainder of eternity.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!23.004!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos emerges from the uncovered path, resolute in leaving. As she looks around, Eidos can see that she has reached the limits of the Salt Forest. The barrier from which she emerged extends out some fifty paces in either direction. At its extremes, the barrier is abetted by two slopes connecting to paths exiting the forest. Both paths appear to offer no obvious chance of reentry into the forest, as they involve drops to lower elevations...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!99.X00!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos stands victorious over the writhing Tacribian, allowing her to breathe her final breaths before abandoning the Falseflesh and rejoin the Spiral. Yet this warrior is eerily calm as she retrieves from among her belongings a brilliant crystal. With a knowing smirk upon her bloodied face, she shatters the crystal between the rocky pillar and her palm with her remaining strength.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!99.01!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The crackling ring of crystal grating on crystal ripples throughout the air like aural fireworks. Then, the shock wave rips limbs from Falseflesh scattering them in all six directions as the intense heat causes everything around to evaporate instantaneously...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!99.50!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos stands victorious over the writhing Tacribian, allowing her to breathe her final breaths before abandoning the Falseflesh and rejoin the Spiral. Yet this warrior is eerily calm as she retrieves from among her belongings a brilliant crystal. With a knowing smirk upon her bloodied face, she shatters the crystal between the rocky pillar and her palm with her remaining strength.

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!99.51!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The crackling ring of crystal grating on crystal ripples throughout the air like aural fireworks. Luin glows brightly, creating an impenetrable shield around Eidos. Though a perfect shield he may be from the superficial damage, Eidos weight is no match for the shock wave that casts her form out from the forest and into the darkness of the crater lurking below...

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.002!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Though the Jinnwraith's shadow may now blind you, you are forever Valvorthr!"

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.003!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I bring us both an end befitting Biracul's faithful..."

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!0.004!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "We'll fight alongside Ark in the Graylands! Together, Shariken!"

D.response_text: "No! Please don't hurt me!"

E.response_text: "You'll find I die hard."

F.response_text: "'Now.' How was that?"

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!1.000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Be you draugnir or nay? Speak now, or perish."

A.response_text: "Fwayya, I'm Eidos. You are Fwayya, aren't you?"

D.response_text: "...Peace, Fwayya. I would help you find your friend."

E.response_text: "You'll find I die hard."

F.response_text: "'Now.' How was that?"

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!1.0011!FWAYYA.dialogue_text: "But make no mistake: the Wasteland will make us both servants of the Jinnwraith soon enough..."

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!1.X002!FWAYYA.dialogue_text: "But before that, I've business here. Don't stand in my way, lest you wish to know the peace of death by my blade."

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!1.101!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "You know of Shen, too. But knowledge cannot change fate."

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!1.102!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "The Wasteland'll make us both loyal servants of the Jinnwraith soon enough..."

KABU!WASTELAND!SALT FOREST!1.X103!FWAYYA.dialogue_text: "Leave; live your final moments in peace, and don't stand in my way."

D.response_text: "You must fulfill your duty as a Ranger and protect me!"

E.response_text: "I'll stand wherever I damn well please."

F.response_text: "...Does 'handstanding' in your way count?"

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.000.dialogue_text: Descending the incline, the floor grays and then blackens, finally losing all color. And before she knows it, Eidos walks upon an inverse mirror. No light reflects from this crater's sandy surface, nor do any shapes define themselves within it. A complete absence is all she sees. A bottomless pit. Yet, her continual stumbles and falls into the dark dust covering the floor reveal the hidden physicality to it - though visually and viscerally it remains hard to accept.

Gripping a loose collection of powder, she lifts it for closer scrutiny. The shards rake at her closed fist, yet draw no blood from the wounds they open. Unfurling her fingers, she stares at what appears to be a hole in the center of her palm. Of greater interest, though, are her own hands, as her palm and fingers are being eaten by countless milky worms. A terrible pain wracks her insides and it takes all Eidos' effort to hold back the bloody vomit promising to spew forth.

Sudden movement garners her attention. Ambling off in the distance and gradually slipping into view are humanoid figures. Slow in their approach, their features are nearly impossible to distinguish other than as shadows dirtied by smears of white flesh. They roil and pulse like pustules bursting forth from the crater's black skin.
The ever-expanding waves wash over her, shocking and numbing her body in alternation.

An ache begins to fill the pit of her stomach, as if the emptiness manifesting within her had finally begun to consume the core of her being. Her Glyphs recede into an infinite distance, blinking out of sight, out of mind, out of existence...
Clutching her swollen abdomen, she rips into the skin with the strength of her grip, staining her fingernails like ink-dipped quills.
Now overwhelmed by the agony, she falls to her hands and knees, lacerating her skin with the dark shards. An inky-black fluid oozes from her open wounds as she expectorates more of the sooty broth.
She regains consciousness, only now realizing she had lost it. Myriad shards of the dark soil beneath her rake at her face. She must have collapsed completely.

The once distant bubbling pustules now stand around her, impassively accepting their newest member. Her awareness wanes as the pain waxes. Motes of black space eat away at her vision and the Glyphs within her mind disappear...

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.001.dialogue_text: Descending the incline, the floor grays and then blackens, finally losing all color. And before she knows it, Eidos walks upon an inverse mirror, no light reflecting from this crater's sandy surface, nor any shapes defining themselves within it. A complete absence is all she sees. A bottomless pit. Yet, her continual stumbles and falls into the dark dust covering the floor reveal the hidden physicality to it - though visually and viscerally it still feels like perpetually falling into a void.

Gripping a loose collection of powder, she lifts it for closer scrutiny. The shards rake at her closed fist, yet draw no blood from the wounds they open. Unfurling her fingers, she stares at what appears to be a hole in the center of her palm. Violently flipping her hand over to regard the back, she sees the skin is pale, but otherwise undisturbed. Turning the hand once more, her gaze falls on the palm. The dark powder is gone, dropped from her previous convulsion, and the illusion is dispelled; the hole is gone, and only a palm remains.

She goes for the dark powder again, this time scooping up a handful. There is a surprising continuity between the powder in her hand and the powder on the ground. Even knowing the trick, her eyes still see a hole piercing her flesh.\n\n\t\tEidos wiggles her fingers, letting the grains shift in her hand, and ultimately pouring the powder back to the ground. The illusory hole in her hand disappears, pale skin rapidly replacing it. As the last grain falls, Eidos dusts her hands off, but a fine powder yet clings to the wan skin, staining it with grayish trails.

Sudden movement steals her attention from the dark dust. Ambling off in the distance and gradually slipping into view are thousands of humanoid figures. Slow in their approach, their features are nearly impossible to distinguish other than as swaying shadows dirtied by smears of white flesh. They roil and pulse like pustules bursting forth from the crater's black skin.
The shapes close the distance with increasing speed, ever-gaining in proximity to Eidos.

D.response_text: Run

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.001.dialogue_text: Panicked, she runs, pounding her feet on the shifting powders beneath her. Her furious dash kicks up a fine cloud of darkness, blotting out her surroundings, erasing the white rash of monsters creeping across the crater's skin...

But Eidos does not react. She stands motionless, unsure of whether she is courageous, curious or simply resigned to whatever should be. She allows the procession of unholy abominations to march toward her, and soon, splinters of tooth and bone gnash all around her, as the draugnir drool their sooty fluids. The creatures circle around her like albino buzzards, eyeing a fresh corpse...

D.response_text: Cajole them

E.response_text: Command them

F.response_text: Get jiggy with them

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.100.dialogue_text: The draugnir abruptly cease their threatening posture. The circles around her breaks and is reshaped into ordered files of marbled hominids - though they still pulse and twitch. Eidos senses no connection to these beings. Indeed, her mind feels more isolated than ever before. Yet, these beings appear to act in sympathy to her own actions.

E.response_text: Lead them to Attack the Dawn Fortress

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.200.dialogue_text: The draugnir abruptly cease their threatening posture. The circles around her breaks and is reshaped into ordered files of marbled hominids - though they still pulse and twitch. Eidos senses no connection to these beings. Indeed, her mind feels more isolated than ever before. Yet, these beings appear to act in sympathy to her own actions.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.300.dialogue_text: The draugnir stagger their circles, giving the impression of a rotating spiral, with Eidos as the unmoving center. Their furor increases, dancing to some perverse, inaudible beat. And yet, they still somehow seem utterly indifferent to Eidos... She herself senses no connection to these beings whatsoever. Indeed, her mind feels more isolated than ever, despite their apparent desire to mirror her thoughts.

D.response_text: Command them to attack each other

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.400.dialogue_text: The draugnir stagger their circles, giving the impression of a rotating spiral, with Eidos as the unmoving center. Their furor increases, dancing to some perverse, inaudible beat. Yet they somehow give the impression of being amenable to Eidos...\tShe senses no connection to these beings whatsoever. Indeed, her mind feels more isolated than ever, despite these beings' apparent desire to mirror her thoughts.

D.response_text: Command them to attack each other

E.response_text: Command them to attack the Dawn Fortress

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.500.dialogue_text: The draugnir stagger their circles, giving the impression of a rotating spiral, with Eidos as the unmoving center. Their furor increases, dancing to some perverse, inaudible beat. Yet they somehow give the impression of subservience to Eidos... She senses no connection to these beings whatsoever. Indeed, her mind feels more isolated than ever, despite these beings' apparent desire to mirror her thoughts.

D.response_text: Command them to attack each other

E.response_text: Command them to attack the Dawn Fortress

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.600.dialogue_text: At Eidos' word, their excitation grows and they start bouncing up and down as though dancing a macabre waltz. It is then clear to Eidos that they are all in fact just gremlins in disguise, mockingly masquerading as mindless draugnir! Crafty creatures, those gremlins... They must be dealt with summarily!

F.response_text: Punch one in the face

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.101.dialogue_text: And just as quickly as they appeared, the draugnir pack then disperses, returning to whatever corrupt pockets whence they emerged...

Her path unobstructed, Eidos is now free to go wherever she wishes. However, she feels her awareness is blinded. Incapable of directing her will towards anything herself, she trusts in fate to guide her. The Tacribian outpost to the west, the lost city of Ur'Ruk to the east and the southern edge of the crater, leading to lower ground, each await her arrival.

A.response_text: Send Eidos west to Ark's Beacon

C.response_text: Send Eidos south to the Crater's Maw

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.201.dialogue_text: The draugnir freeze in time, and their statuesque bodies do not reply or react to her words or thoughts. They stand as still as death, caught in the interstice between two moments.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.301.dialogue_text: Eidos decides to actively do nothing. Shrugging her shoulders, she walks away. However, the band of draugnir move in synchronous with her, perfect mirrors of her every step, her every pause.

D.response_text: Command them to attack each other

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.401.dialogue_text: With frenzied abandon, the draugnir throw themselves into brutal combat. Pale flesh is rent by bleached bone maws and gulped into gaping black mouths. Eidos is splattered by gritty, silty blood, black as night. Subsequently, the crater becomes a mass grave for these undead wretches, the mephitic stench of graphite and sulfur fouling up the air around it as they tear each other asunder...

But soon, all is still, the scattered smears of white upon the shadowy ground the only evidence of their pain, death and sacrifice. Yet the windswept dust will soon cover all trace of this unsung battle; the allies of entropy are numerous indeed.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.501.dialogue_text: The draugnir legions let out a howl of exaltation, signaling the pact between them and their new Jinnwraith. Having been thus accepted by her new charges, Eidos now walks across the void field of the Stilled Sand Crater towards Ark's Beacon with the ravening host of the pit at her back.\n\n\t\tOnwards they march through a corrupted and warped subset of space where time overlaps, folding in on itself, and the overwhelming weight of memory subjugates free will. All Eidos can do is watch as It acts through her, for she or It has chosen and will choose a similar path. And they will repeat this until the day the Elder Gods abandon this world to its cursed fate of fading into a forgotten memory...
But now she sees through eyes equal hers and not; she moves compelled by waves of emotion in a stormy sea. She is everything and all is her. Thus, all is as it should be.

Rikharr hosts silent Hel within his shell and seeks to ease the pain of the living Kavans. Once their mage, their protector, he neglected his duties in pursuit of Self-centered knowledge. This knowledge now drives him to act for his people, accelerating their destruction, eliminating the need to struggle with the despair that entropy, that Hel, promises for all.
No phoenix will rise from the ashes Rikharr plans to leave. He will uproot life and salt the lands, giving a destruction most thorough. Not even weeds will grow from the ruins.

The Sun Tower will be first. A symbol of the victory his people will achieve in death. He summons from the depths of his ghost a destructive Glyph to make rubble of the base. Yet in so doing, he cedes agency to the void nestled within him. The result is a complete erasure of the second story of the tower. Gone. Nothing remaining in its stead. Just an empty void.

As the second story phases out of existence, his concentration wavers and the Techne's effects cease. Losing its supports, the upper floors of the tower crash down upon its base and teeter, eventually succumbing to gravity and diving into the canyon.\n\n\t\tThe unprepared garrison residing within cry in anguish, screaming from fright and desperation in equal measure, as the tower cascades down toward the canyon floor. Fortunate they are, then, as their trip ends with an abrupt and violent impact into the earth, thus ending all fear they might have had with a mercifully instantaneous death.

Those who were not within the Sun Tower stand awestruck at the fate of their comrades, a state which soon turns to terror as the undying horde of draugnir take their first bite into the flesh of their unprepared victims. Easily dispatching these uncoordinated stragglers, the draugnir then join with the advancing Rikharr who has already begun his trek across the gargantuan bridge spanning the canyon.

But it seems that Kavu is not caught completely unaware, as a familiar face rears itself giving obstacle to Rikharr's vanguard of draugnir: Ark, then Librarian, now Archmage of all Kavu and its peoples. She will not be dissuaded by Rikharr's impassioned appeal to free the people from the tyranny of the Others. Their conflict is now inevitable.

The battle is as expected of an Archmage and the host of the void demon, Hel. As ineffable as it is awe-inspiring, the magi collide in an unrelenting contest of wills. None present can comprehend the dark and destructive Techne being summoned from the abyss; nor can they fathom the sheer divinity of the protective Techne Ark conjures up from the Empyrean to preserve the lives of her Valvorthr. Soon, Luin proves too much for Rikharr, rending his flesh in twain, severing his head from his shoulders... Yet, the dark miasma dwelling within him does not allow for so sudden a death and binds the two together again.
Ark, knows now that she fights not Rikharr, but the void within him...

The battle lasts but an instant. Yet, though a spark dies no sooner than it is born, to the spark it seems a lifetime has passed. Likewise to the fated enemies, the seemingly eternal battle ends only as Ark drives Luin through the Rikharr's bowels, pinning him to the bridge. Ark's Valvorthr leave her to rout the jinncursed draugnir, now aimlessly wandering the dunes around the ruined Sun Tower.

Ark and her followers are victorious, but she is at a loss as to how best detain her former master. The Kavans would accept nothing less than his death, but an uncontrollable guilt overwhelms Ark. She decides that his undying Falseflesh is prison enough and that the Wellspring is a fitting place for a former Daziran mage. As she and her Valvorthr make their preparations to return, a blue-cloaked individual emerges from the dust of the Wastes and approaches a cagey Ark...

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.502.dialogue_text: The stranger claims he is the Biracul of Kavan lore, and requests of Ark that she replace Rikharr as Hel's vessel. Only she is strong enough to withstand the solitude which awaits the vessel in the Dungeon of the Void. Her guilt subsides, as fate decides what her punishment for betrayal must be. She understands what she must do and accepts her charge, her duty to the All-Seer. In an excruciating act of faith, she absorbs the scourge of the Wastes and, after extraordinary pain, becomes its new vessel.
Instructing her Valvorthr to take the still breathing Rikharr into the Hall of Atonement and guard him until her return, she departs with Biracul for the fabled city of Urugh.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!1.601.dialogue_text: With Stalphos' violent intent as a spark, the gremlins now ignite into a spectacular explosion of utter destruction. They begin to rip each other to shreds in a barbaric and soot-laden bloodbath. Bludgeoning, biting, screaming and raging. Electric guitars wail in the background as Eidos bathes in the mayhem surrounding her.
But what goes up must come down, and soon the swell of rage abates as no participants remain. In the end, they have annihilated themselves... To the max!

With all these gremlins now rightfully slain - and by their own hands, nonetheless! - the path is open for the Hero of Tomorrow to continue questing for the Jade Monkey in this, the perilous dominion of the Gremlin King.

A.response_text: Pay those killjoy Tacribians a visit

C.response_text: Mosey on over to the Crater's Maw

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!2.X00.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the unrelenting darkness of the crater. The stench of unrotting flesh of draugnir permeates the air, but the location of their gore and remains cannot be discerned.\n\n\t\tEidos feels no need to remain. However, she likewise feels her awareness is blinded. Incapable of directing her will towards anything herself, she trusts in fate to guide her. The Tacribian outpost to the west, the lost city of Ur'Ruk to the east and the southern edge of the crater, leading to lower ground, each await her arrival.

A.response_text: Send Eidos west to Ark's Beacon

C.response_text: Send Eidos south to the Crater's Maw

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!2.X50.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the unrelenting darkness of the crater. The draugnir are nowhere to be seen, though almost nothing can be discerned in this black pit.\n\n\t\tTrying to decide where to head, Eidos looks only to the east, though she is not entirely sure why. However, some decisions are best made by the hand of fate, instead.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!2.500.dialogue_text: Eidos marches again into the unrelenting darkness of the crater, her army in train. Though Eidos feels no need to remain, she likewise feels her awareness is blinded in this cursed place. She is frozen, incapable of deciding where to head. Some decisions are best made by the hand of fate, instead.

A.response_text: Send Eidos et al east to Ur'Ruk

E.response_text: Assault the nearby outpost off to the west

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!3.000.dialogue_text: Eidos comes tumbling down from the ridge of the crater upon which the Salt Forest stands. She continues her inelegant descent until gravity's desire to tug at her is stifled by the ground's harsh embrace.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!3.001.dialogue_text: The prickly pierces of myriad shards dot her face and hands. Propping herself up drives them further into her skin. Some fall to the ground, but many are absorbed and disappear. Now standing, she dusts her clothes off and begins to walk deeper into the crater.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!10.X0.dialogue_text: Eidos walks upon an inverse mirror, no reflections or definition reveal themselves in the rocky surface. Black does not suffice to describe its color; it is the absolute absence of color that defines its visual aspect. Only through her continual stumbles and falls into the dark dust does she know she walks upon solid stone - though to her it feels like perpetually falling into a void.

Eidos wiggles her fingers, letting the grains shift in her hand, and ultimately pouring the powder from her hand back to the ground. Sudden movement garners her attention. Ambling off in the distance and gradually slipping into view are humanoid figures. The shapes close the distance with increasing speed, ever-gaining in proximity to Eidos.

D.response_text: Run

But Eidos does not react. She stands motionless, unsure of whether she is courageous, curious or simply resigned to whatever should be. She allows the procession of unholy abominations to march toward her, and soon, splinters of tooth and bone gnash all around her, as the draugnir drool their sooty fluids. The creatures circle around her like albino buzzards, eying a fresh corpse...

D.response_text: Cajole them

E.response_text: Command them

F.response_text: Get jiggy with them

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!11.00.dialogue_text: Eidos leads her army of Neverborn as they walk upon an inverse mirror, no reflections or definition apparent in the rocky surface. Black does not suffice to describe its color; it is the absolute absence of color that defines its visual aspect. Only through her continual stumbles and falls into the dark dust does she know she walks upon solid stone - though to her it feels like perpetually falling into a void.

Gripping a loose collection of powder, she lifts it for closer scrutiny. The shards rake at her closed fist, yet draw no blood from the wounds they open. Returning her gaze to the palm, the dark powder having dropped at her convulsions, the illusion is dispelled; only a palm remains.

She goes for the dark powder again, this time scooping up a handful. There is a surprising continuity between the powder in her hand and the powder on the ground. Even knowing the trick, her eyes still see a hole piercing her flesh. Eidos wiggles her fingers, letting the grains shift in her hand, and ultimately pouring the powder from her hand back to the ground. The illusory hole in her hand appears to disappear, pale skin rapidly replacing it. As the last grain falls, Eidos dusts her hands off, a fine powder staining the wan skin with grayish trails.

Sudden movement garners her attention. Ambling off in the distance and gradually slipping into view are humanoid figures. Slow in their approach, their features are nearly impossible to distinguish other than as shadows dirtied by smears of white flesh. They roil and pulse like pustules bursting forth from the crater's black skin.
The pearlescent shapes close the distance with increasing speed, ever-gaining in proximity to Eidos.

But Eidos does not react. Backed by her legion of Neverborn soldiers, she stands motionless, allowing the procession of unholy abominations to march toward her. Soon, splinters of tooth and bone gnash and crackle, as the draugnir drool their sooty fluids but twenty paces away.

D.response_text: Send your Neverborn army to attack them

E.response_text: Charge into battle along with your army

F.response_text: Tell them to stop... collaborate and listen.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!11.10.dialogue_text: The draugnir do not respond to her hails and only continue their slow march forward.

E.response_text: Fight them

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!11.20.dialogue_text: If the draugnir lived, Eidos and her Neverborn would be close enough to feel their breath. Though all she can hear is the grinding of their teeth, so close are they. But it is only when they are face to face that their motion finally comes to a halt.

E.response_text: Fight them

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!11.40.dialogue_text: At a mere thought, her Neverborn legions spring forward to fearlessly give a second death to the creatures of the blackened pit...

Maws of white bite down on pallid skin, producing blooms of grayscale fluid that stain the ground in shining luminosity. A macabre palette of shades is mixed as the black ichor of those that were refused death is mixed with the azure lifeblood of those who were never given life.\n\n\t\tFor every fallen enemy an ally likewise expires, and ultimately, both sides cease to exist. In the end, none are left to enact or thwart Eidos, the sole survivor of an unsung battle.

Her path unobstructed, Eidos is now free to go wherever she wishes. However, she feels her awareness is blinded. Incapable of directing her will towards anything herself, she trusts in fate to guide her. The Tacribian outpost to the west, the lost city of Ur'Ruk to the east and the southern edge of the crater, leading to lower ground, each await her arrival.

C.response_text: Send Eidos south to Crater's Maw

F.response_text: Let out a mighty caw and charge!

A.response_text: Continue to the east side of the crater

E.response_text: Assault the nearby outpost off to the west

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!11.55.dialogue_text: Eidos demands her army follow her to the crater's edge, and onward to the east, to the boundaries of sanity and existence. Obediently, they follow.

KABU!WASTELAND!STILLED SAND CRATER!11.60.dialogue_text: Stalphos commands her goblin army to charge with her at the lead. The two groups clash and rip each other to shreds in a masterful ballad of violence, penned in their inky blood. Bludgeoning, biting, screaming and raging. Electric guitars wail in the background as Eidos bathes in the mayhem surrounding her.
But what goes up must come down, and soon the swell of rage abates as no participants remain. In the end, they have annihilated themselves... To the max!

With all these gremlins now rightfully slain - and to the max, nonetheless! - the path is open for the Hero of Tomorrow to continue questing for the Jade Monkey in this, the perilous dominion of the Gremlin King.
