C.response_text: Mosey on over to the Crater's Maw

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Though the pillars have noticeably thinned out along this downward slope, their numbers still make forward scouting impossible. The pillars' continuity also causes Eidos to miss the fact that a drop roughly twice her height hides right before her. But she certainly notices as soon as she steps over the edge and into the air - a poor platform for walking, in truth.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Tumbling down to the platform below, a salt bank dampens the impact of her first kiss with the ground. Embarrassed but unharmed, she rises and weaves between the last remaining pillars.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Emerging from the Salt Forest and blinded by the setting sun, Eidos nearly takes one step too many. A step right off a sheer drop of an overwhelming magnitude. Though the fog below obfuscates the final landing point, from where she stands to just the fog must be several hundreds times her height.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Her vision blurs and her head spins.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.004!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Hurriedly stepping back, she adheres herself to one of the massive salt pillars and she stares at the ground in an attempt to pacify her rapidly beating heart. But her eyes pulsate with every heartbeat, expanding and contracting, throwing all visuals into chaotic disarray.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.005!DESCRI.dialogue_text: She breathes deeply, slowly tempering the fires of her mind, and reining in her wild heart.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!0.006!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Soon her vision returns, greeted by a mixture of the salt and sand revealing a clearly unnatural pattern carved into the stone beneath. She looks up, first casting her gaze southwest where she sees the pitch black of an immense crater. Even in the light of the sun, its features are indistinguishable and all-consuming. It looks as if a patch of midnight were lying suspended before her in defiance of the pitiless face of the sun. Beyond the ridge of the crater, due south, she sees a collection of distant, broken towers. A short drop - twice her height or so - off the southern ledge where she currently stands leads to the crater towards the ruined city.

A.response_text: Proceed towards the city to the south

B.response_text: Look off into the distance toward the north

C.response_text: Kick some more sand on the pattern etched into the ground

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Staring off across the thick fog as it bleeds into barren flatlands far below, Eidos sees a mountain range off in the distance. Though it is far too distant to see anything with any clarity. She sees a flash of light. Real or imagined, it vanishes in an instant. Jer. She knows it as Jer, home of Thetian. And but a handspan to the east is the Enclave. Was the Enclave. Or will Ormenos be there yet again?

A.response_text: Proceed towards the city to the south

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: For reasons Eidos herself does not comprehend, she is led to the edge of the precipice and filled with the immense horror of knowing she will jump.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!1.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Desperately struggling against the urge, her feet take the final and irreversible step forward casting her earthbound at an ever-accelerating speed.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!1.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Wind drags tears from her fragile eyes. Yet she wishes to see it all. She sees the fog approaching, enveloping and then vanishing. She sees the cracked and desiccated flats that spell her death, ever-gaining in definition and clarity.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!1.004!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Yet all things must come to an end and so it does as her Falseflesh liquefies upon impact with the ground below, releasing the Trueflesh of the Self off into the infinite, where it will find its new home once more.

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!2.X000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos kicks more sand upon the pattern on the floor, then proceeds to get down on all fours and blow the excess away. This process reveals what can clearly be described as writing, yet to Eidos, it is utterly incomprehensible.

A.response_text: Proceed towards the city to the south

KABU!WASTELAND!TORMA'S GIFT!2.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
Eidos kicks more sand upon the pattern on the floor, then proceeds to get down on all fours and blow the excess away. Carved in the Script of Vanargand, it reads:

		"YOUR PRIZE OF EXPLORATION!
		THE NORTHERN VIEW, OF JER BE.
		TO THE SOUTH, LOST UR'RUK LIES.
		THERE I SOJOURN BEFORE YOU.
		DO NOT THE BLACK PIT DESCEND,
		LEST THE JINNWRAITH YOU CONSUME.
		-TORMA"

A.response_text: Proceed towards the city to the south

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.X0000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The terrain evens out into a flat plateau. Yet, while Eidos is now spared the exertion of steep ascents, the unrelenting wind is likewise free of impediment. Soon, a deadly mixture of fine particles and razor-sharp sand is conjured up from the ground, spiraling all about her. Eidos is forced to shield her unprotected eyes against the stinging cyclones of glassy assailants.\n\n\t\tUp ahead, through the whirling veil of dust and sand, she can make out a forest of white pillars, salty giants rising up from the desert wastes with a regularity belying their artificial nature. And yet the forest is vast, utterly beyond the reach of man.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.0001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Several hundred rhythmic thuds of her feet against the sand carry her closer to the sleeping giants. Nearby a quick flash catches Eidos' eye. Between her and the salt pillars, a landmark half-buried in a dune of silt and sand enters her awareness. It appears to be a calcified mound with hints of cobalt blue beneath, shimmering in the midday sun.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.0002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Drawing nearer, she realizes the mound is no natural feature of the land. It looks to be the desiccated remains of a long-dead creature. Walking around it some twenty paces, Eidos sees only part of its head and spine clawing through a sandy outer crust, like the fleeing bones of a man unaware of his own death. What little she can see, however, only hints at the enormous stature of the beast.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.0003!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Seeking to fit the whole creature within her field of view, Eidos backs away from the beast's mouth, and in so doing, nearly falls into a sudden depression in the sand. The displaced chunk appears to have collapsed down onto a lower shelf, a place she could certainly descend to, but would equally certainly be unable to return from.\n\n\t\tBeneath her feet, the ground is formed from writhing, snaking patterns of what looks to be impacted salt, melted together under immense heat or pressure. Jutting up from this surface are jagged spikes of ever-increasing height, composed of the same white crystalline material that seems to cover the pillars. These spikes lead from the creature's open mouth out into the east and merge with the salt pillars below.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The terrain evens out into a flat plateau. Yet, while Eidos is now spared the exertion of steep ascents, the wind is likewise free of impediment. Soon, a deadly mixture of fine particles and razor shards is conjured up from the ground, spiraling all about her. Eidos is forced to shield her unprotected eyes against the stinging cyclones of glassy assailants.\n\n\t\tUp ahead, the salty white giants mark her proximity to the Salt Forest.

A.response_text: Proceed towards the white pillars of the Salt Forest

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: After an endless slog through knee-high dunes, Eidos again approaches the desiccated husk of the long-dead beast - a lonely reminder of the fate meted out even to the strong on this unforgiving plane of existence.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: She regards the beast with apprehension. Lifeless for centuries - perhaps even millennia now - she ultimately concludes that the creature possess no apparent threat. Now approaching to scrutinize it, Eidos sees that the metallic blue sheen extends the length of its carapace. She likewise discovers two holes in the head, revealing what were once the void eyes of the creature. The calcified layer atop the metallic husk seems to have been a trait acquired postmortem and cracks away at random intervals, flaking off and rejoining its dusty brethren upon the desert floor. What is visible of the carcass shows the dying reflections of large segmented plates, dulling with age. However, their composition is unrecognizable, so encrusted and mineralized are they by the raging shardstorm that sweeps across the Wasteland.\n\n\t\tNumerous gashes and puncture wounds provide a look into this beast's violent life, as well as its equally violent end. Peering into one of the wounds, the meager rays of the waning sun unveil pools of blue liquid welled up within. Yet the sun is weak and frightened to reach deeper into this dark and deathly domain.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
She regards the beast with apprehension. Lifeless for centuries - perhaps millennia now - she ultimately concludes that the creature possess no apparent threat. Now approaching to scrutinize it, Eidos sees that the metallic blue sheen extends the length of its carapace. She likewise discovers two holes in the head, revealing what were once the void eyes of the creature.

		The calcified layer atop the metallic husk seems to have been a trait acquired postmortem and cracks away at random intervals, flaking off and rejoining its dusty brethren upon the desert floor. What is visible of the carcass shows the dying reflections of large segmented plates, dulling with age. However, their composition is unrecognizable, so encrusted and mineralized are they by the raging shardstorm that sweeps across the Wasteland.

		Numerous gashes and puncture wounds provide a look into this beast's violent life, as well as its equally violent end. Peering into one of the wounds, the meager rays of the waning sun unveil pools of blue liquid welled up within. Yet the sun is weak and frightened to reach deeper into this dark and deathly domain.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Before her thought can be completed, Eidos feels a stirring awareness. As she recollects her experiences from lives both lived and unlived, a sympathetic memory shimmers about this place. As though the forlorn carcass had struck a tuning fork, calling forth a tone of her frequency, she feels the resonance of its memory. With her waking eyes, she can see the creature unwither before her.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.002!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: A fragmented mind, with a singular focus drives Gulgadorn, Gurgadon and Gulganna across wide stretches of dead earth, mowing down the magi of the Ataraxia and seeking the destruction of the Large Crystal Array. Gulgadorn, the Beast of Vedt, stands upon ground-cracking limbs, its gleaming carapace marred by sound-shattering projectiles. The creature shakes its massive frame as the burning embers of its spine send forth waves of molten air. The echoes of death reverberate in the crackling of boiling air and in the pain of the unseen assailants as flesh is melted and bone blackened by the incandescent vapor. Gulgadorn turns its dripping maw towards the Shining City of Urugh. Eidos looks upon the gleaming white crystals that rise up like a garden of ice, and knows that they are the source of her awareness.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.003!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Gulgadorn unhinges its jaw and belches forth a blinding spout of concentrated mist in a silence-splitting roar. The glass structures immediately melt and crack as they are bathed in pneuma that burns with the heat of a dying star. The hellfire of Gulgadorn's breath slowly coalesces the crystals into a single inert piece, freezing them in time, killing Conscientia...

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.004!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The vision abruptly terminates and Eidos is left standing before the gaping mouth of Gulgadorn, the beast as vanquished as its ancient foes. Yet she is likewise left with a bizarre desire to sit down beside the beast and rest with it. Though she knows, somehow, that if she were to give in to this bout of nostalgia, the effects would be irreversible.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.005!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: And yet for reasons Eidos may never understand, she sits and rests alongside her former companion through countless cycles of day and night, through countless iterations of glassy cyclones. No new visions visit her mind, but to some odd degree she is at peace. And it is only then the Self realizes that in relinquishing Eidos, it can move on to its next vessel, in some distant land, at some remote time. Its ghost regards the Falseflesh it leaves behind this time as it floats off into the infinite.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: The terrain evens out into a flat plateau. Yet, while Eidos and Heyar are now spared the exertion of steep ascents, the unrelenting wind is likewise free of impediment. Soon, a deadly mixture of fine particles and razor shards is conjured up from the ground, spiraling all about them. They are forced to shield their unprotected eyes against the stinging cyclones of glassy assailants, though the insane scholar laughs the whole time.\n\n\t\tUp ahead, through the whirling veil of dust and sand, Eidos can make out a forest of white pillars, salty giants rising up from the desert wastes with a regularity belying their artificial nature. And yet the forest is vast, utterly beyond the reach of man.

Walking around it some twenty paces, Eidos sees only part of its head and spine clawing through a sandy outer crust, like the fleeing bones of a man unaware of his own death. What little she can see, however, only hints at the enormous stature of the beast.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.003!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
Seeking to fit the whole creature within her field of view, Eidos backs away from the beast's mouth, and in so doing, nearly falls into a sudden depression in the sand. The displaced chunk appears to have collapsed down onto a lower shelf, a place she could certainly descend to, but would equally certainly be unable to return from.

		Beneath her feet, the ground is formed from writhing, snaking patterns of what looks to be impacted salt, melted together under immense heat or pressure. Jutting up from this surface are jagged spikes of ever-increasing height, composed of the same white crystalline material that seems to cover the pillars. These spikes lead from the creature's open mouth out into the east and merge with the salt pillars below.

		And of course, the eccentric Heyar appears to be milling about as though he were looking for his next 'great' find.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.010!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The terrain evens out into a flat plateau. Yet, while Eidos and Heyar are now spared the exertion of steep ascents, the wind is likewise free of impediment. Soon, a deadly mixture of fine particles and razor shards is conjured up from the ground, spiraling all about them. The two are forced to shield their unprotected eyes against the stinging cyclones of glassy assailants, though the insane scholar laughs the whole time.\n\n\t\tUp ahead, through the whirling veil of dust and sand, the salty white giants mark their proximity to the Salt Forest.

A.response_text: Proceed towards the white pillars of the Salt Forest

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.011!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: After an endless slog through knee-high dunes, Eidos again approaches the desiccated husk of the long-dead beast - a lonely reminder of the fate meted out even to the strong on this unforgiving plane of existence.\n\n\t\tHeyar looks quizzically at the creature, alternately wringing his hands and letting out occasional yelps of excitement - somewhat akin to a buzzard's mating call, perhaps.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.012!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: From here, Eidos can descend into the Salt Forest, though returning from it would be impossible from this location. Land's End lies behind her.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.013!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: As Eidos makes for the Salt Forest, she notices that Heyar is lost in reverie, speaking and gesturing to himself, as though he were practicing some grand lecture he will never give. She thinks back upon their journey together and recalls the Daziran's inability to tear himself away from the sound of his own thoughts. With a shrug and sigh - of resignation or perhaps relief - Eidos climbs down the steep embankment alone.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!3.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos approaches the bizarre scholar, noticing that his gaze is fixed, unmovingly cast upon the husk with an unnatural grin of elation. He clearly has much to say...

A.response_text: On second thought, best let sleeping dogs lie...

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!3.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The conversation concludes and Eidos is left with several possibilities...

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!90.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Though he appeared to have entered death's embrace, there is a resurgence of life in the stubborn scholar as he gasps for air, futilely clinging to life. Heyar dramatically clutches his wounds as he disappointedly gazes upon the crimson flow gushing from wound to sand. His dying body twitches and shudders in an effort to make one last, grand gesticulation as his doom draws near...

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!90.001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: After an intolerably lengthy period of concerted effort and hyperbolic moans of agony, he manages to raise a finger, as though trying to pause a conversation, to interject a final word before he is forever silenced. Here Heyar makes his last stand against Nature and the Harbinger of his cruel fate!

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!90.X002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Yet, his dying thoughts go mercifully unspoken as his ghost passes on into the great unknown.

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.X0000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Oh, it's you! And alive at that!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.0000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "We appear to have both beaten the odds thus far... And here's to our continued success!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.00000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Did you come here in search of the beast of the Vedt, as I have?"

A.response_text: "What interest does this creature hold for you?"

C.response_text: "This is where I happened to end up."

D.response_text: "I just seek to live another day, Heyar."

E.response_text: "Didn't I tell you to leave me alone?"

F.response_text: "Nah, I'm not into beastiality."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.X0001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Oh, it's you! And alive at that!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.0001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "We appear to have both beaten the odds thus far... And here's to our continued success!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.0002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Did you come here in search of the beast of the Vedt, as I have?"

A.response_text: "What interest does this creature hold for you?"

B.response_text: "I've seen similar creatures in the Wellspring."

C.response_text: "This is where I happened to end up."

D.response_text: "This creature is commonplace in the Wellspring."

E.response_text: "Didn't I tell you to leave me alone?"

F.response_text: "Nah, I'm not into beastiality."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.100!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "What interest?! Why this is the ancient war machine of the Vedt! Controlled by the Thiuda themselves!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.1000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Yes, in their epic battle against the Ataraxia around two millennia ago! Marvelous!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.1001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "You know some scholars even say the ancient structures dotting this land signify that this was the very location of the Ataraxian stronghold! And..."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.1002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Oh dear, am I talking too much again? Sorry!"

A.response_text: "How is it you know so much about the past?"

D.response_text: "Can we harness the war machine's power?"

E.response_text: "Maybe you can learn about the Ars Silent-ia from this machine."

F.response_text: "I was chillin' with one of these the other day."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.200!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Why this is the ancient war machine of the Vedt! Controlled by the Thiuda themselves!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.2000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "You mean to say there're more right here under our very noses!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.2001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "But why have the Daziran magi been hiding this knowledge from us?!"

A.response_text: "How do you know so much about the past?"

B.response_text: "That there's more to this story than we've been told."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.300!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Well, you happened to end up in a very interesting place!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.400!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "But my friend! A day without learning is a day not worth living!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.4000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "This is my virgin sighting of an ancient war machine of the Thiuda and I imagine it's a similarly unique experience for you, too!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.4001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "We must take advantage of the time we have to learn while we're still human! Ha ha!"

D.response_text: "Can we harness the war machine's power?"

E.response_text: "Maybe you can learn about the Ars Silent-ia from this machine."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.4002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "You mean to say there're more right here under our very noses!?"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.4003!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "But why have the Daziran magi been hiding this knowledge from us?!"

D.response_text: "That there's more to this story than we've been told."

E.response_text: "That it's quiet shut up time for you."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.5001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "But I'll simply go on with my investigations ... in SILENCE! Ha ha! Sorry, I just love ironic juxtaposition!"

D.response_text: "Do so, unless you ever have anything useful to say."

E.response_text: "You should learn how to be silent."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.600!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! I share your distaste for that, certainly!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!0.6000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Yet there's much we can learn here!"

F.response_text: "You seem like a smart guy. Can I ask you something?"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Ah! Yes! As expected! This is the ancient war machine of the Vedt! Controlled by the Thiuda themselves!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.0000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Yes, in their epic battle against the Ataraxia around two millennia ago. Marvelous! You know some scholars even say the ancient structures dotting this land signify that this was the very location of the Ataraxian stronghold! And..."

D.response_text: "Can we harness the war machine's power?"

E.response_text: "Maybe you can learn about the Ars Silent-ia from this machine."

F.response_text: "I bet almighty Roostor brought peace to the land."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.0010!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Yes, in their epic battle against the Ataraxia around two millennia ago. Marvelous! You know some scholars even say the ancient structures dotting this land signify that this was the very location of the Ataraxian stronghold! And..."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.0011!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Oh dear, am I talking too much again? Sorry!"

A.response_text: "How is it you know so much about the past?"

B.response_text: "I've seen similar creatures in the Wellspring."

D.response_text: "This creature is commonplace in the Wellspring."

E.response_text: "Maybe you can learn about the Ars Silent-ia from this machine."

F.response_text: "I was chillin' with one of these the other day."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.100!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "It's all there, in the tomes! I wonder why so few know about the past when it so readily gives up its secrets to us!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.1000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Instead they fuss over superstitions and superficial differences among them and engage in pointless wars like the Thiuda and the Ataraxia! ... or the Dazirans and the Tacribians, for that matter. Ha ha!"

E.response_text: "Perhaps you overestimate the value of the past."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.200!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Splendid! A scholar of the past you are, just as am I!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.2000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Where was I? Ah! Yes! The Thiuda!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.2001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Well, in the township of Tambul, there's a statue in the atrium depicting the slaying of a chimera by a Thiudan champion. The Thiudan legions descended all the way to our humble region to battle the forces of Ataraxia!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.2002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Their powerful mage Wulfias commanded the Thiudan forces here in Kabu and decimated the region!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.2003!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "We Dazirans even believe that he took control of the Wellspring."

A.response_text: "That through knowing the past, we can know ourselves."

B.response_text: "That there's more to this story than we've been told."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.300!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Sorry! I just believe that discussion is part of a balanced life - and the more, the better I say! Ha ha!"

D.response_text: "Only if you've got something useful to say."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.400!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Doubtful. Unless you have the Techne skills of a Wulfias or the Jinns... though, with enough study I suppose anything is possible. Ha ha!"

D.response_text: "What must I study to obtain such skills?"

E.response_text: "Then you're wasting my time with this chit-chat."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X500!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! You're certainly free with your words! But I shall keep my musings to a minimum. Ha ha! Sorry!"

D.response_text: "Do so, unless what you've got to say is useful."

E.response_text: "As you should."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.600!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Though my knowledge is meager, perhaps I can be of assistance!"

A.response_text: "What came first, the chicken or the egg?"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.6000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I suppose it has to be the chicken, in that case!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.6001!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Because in your question, you listed it first! Ha ha!"

F.response_text: "Makes sense! Guess you're not entirely useless after all!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X6002!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "You're free with your words! Ha ha! But perhaps we should continue on with our investigations, shall we?"

F.response_text: "TALLY HO!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.101!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Indeed! I imagine that with a solid understanding of the past, we wouldn't so readily repeat it continuously! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X1010!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Yes, this is so exciting! Let's continue on with our investigations, shall we?"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.201!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Yes! I assure you there is! There always is! We must dig deeper! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X2010!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Sorry! I just get excited when talking about these things! Let's continue on with our exploration, shall we?!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X301!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Not interested in discussion, eh? Sorry! I'll keep my musings to a minimum!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.401!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Sorry! I don't know much about the Ars Techne! Never was one for science and math! Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X4010!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Let's get on with our investigations, shall we?!"

D.response_text: "I see why people hate scholars now."

E.response_text: "You're as annoying as you are unhelpful, I see."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.501!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Impossible! Ha ha! Sorry, but it's not possible to overestimate the value of the past!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X5010!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "I'm so excited to explore this strange, new land! Let's get on with our exploration, shall we?"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.601!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I've never heard of the deity Roostor... I wonder if Dary might have heard of him? Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!1.X6010!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Sorry! But she is far more qualified than I to speak about deities! Let's get on with our investigations, shall we?!"

F.response_text: "You make ME look sane..."

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Oh, sorry, was I making bizarre gestures and talking to myself again? Ha ha!"

KABU!WASTELAND!THE VEDT!2.0000!HEYAR!.dialogue_text: "I was just thinking about death and dying again and practicing my eulogy. Sorry!"
